loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, and beverages.

loans.name: Maria Maximinia

texts.es: María Maximinia de sesenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida su hija y sus nietos en casa propia, ella posee una panadería donde vende pan en variedad dulce y salado, su especialidad es el pan francés y es el más vendido, tiene muchos años de experiencia en este rubro por eso elabora el pan más delicioso del lugar, el negocio está ubicado en su residencia pero lo comercia afuera del mercado de la localidad, tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de primera calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles, María es una mujer muy trabajadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante y regalarse un futuro mejor, piensa que el triunfo no está en vencer siempre, sino en nunca desanimarse, quiere aumentar la producción de pan porque aumento la demanda es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor, levadura, dulce, leche, algunas bandejas etc. Tiene muy buen record crediticio por eso está segura que sabrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
64-year old María Maximinia lives with her husband, daughter, and grandchildren in her own home. She runs a bakery where she sells various types of bread, cakes, and savory items. Her specialty is French bread which is also the most popular with her customers. She has many years of experience so makes the most delicious bread in the area. Her business is located in her house but she sells the baking outside the local market. She has many customers because everyone knows that what she makes is of the highest quality and at good prices. 

María is a hardworking woman with a great desire to get ahead and obtain a better future for herself. She believes that success isn’t only a matter of victory, but also in not becoming discouraged. She wishes to increase the amount of bread she makes because demand has gone up, so she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy flour at wholesale prices, yeast, caramel, milk, trays etc. María has a very good credit rating so she is sure that she will be able to make the repayments and at the same time provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour at wholesale prices, yeast, caramel, milk, trays etc.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Monsieur Ousmane est commercant depuis 10 ans. Il est agè de 35 ans et encore cèlibataire . Son activitè consiste à vendre du foin et de l' aliment bètail, il a ouvert une cantine pas loin de chez lui. Il est à son 1èr crèdit à l' IMCEC et il sollicite un montant de 50000FCFA pour acheter 10 sacs de foin et 20 sacs d' aliment bètail. Ousmane n'a pas de charges et aimerait amèliorer son commerce en diversifiant ses produits et services.
texts.en: Ousmane has been involved in retail business for the past ten years.  He is 35 years old and still single.  His activity consists in selling hay and cattle feed.  He has opened a stall not far from where he lives.  This is his first loan with UIMCEC and he is requesting 50,000 CFA francs for the purchase of 10 bags of hay and 20 bags of cattle feed.  Ousmane has no expenses, and he would like to improve his business while diversifying his products and services.

loans.use: to buy hay and cattle feed for resale.

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka is a 41-year-old farmer from a small village in Samtredia District, West Georgia. Eka is married and lives with her family: husband – Carlo, 19-year-old son, and mother-in-law (pensioner). 

The family has two milk cows. Eka produces cheese and sells on average 40 kg of this product in Samtredia District. Along with the above mentioned, the family owns a plot of land with 250 nut trees. Eka sells harvested nuts on the same market. Carlo works for the Georgian Railway Company as a worker and gets a monthly salary. 

Eka requested credit for purchasing a mini-tractor. Carlo will use it for tilling family-owned land, as well as performing orders for neighborhood farmers. The family will get additional income and will use it for financing the education of their son, who is a student.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-tractor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en:
Iqbal is a 21-year-old man who is studying in the third year of university. He entered Teacher`s University in 2010 and his education fee has been paid by his father. 

Although everyone is working in Iqbal`s family, paying the education fee is quite expensive, and that’s why he applied for a 1,400 AZN loan.  

After graduation, he will be a certified teacher of mathematics and informatics.

loans.use: to pay for university education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Parviz is 21 years old and a very friendly student. He is studying in his third year of Teachers University on the History and Geographic faculty. He is not working because studying at university takes all his time. 

He lives with his parents, both of whom are working. However, beginning last year, the education fees increased and Parviz’s father was not able to pay his full education fee. To save the situation, he applied for a 1,200 AZN loan from AqroInvest CU.  

Parviz wishes to complete his education and join as a teacher in the local school.

loans.use: to pay education fees.

loans.name: Sabuhi

texts.en: Sabuhi is 22 years old.  He entered university in the fall of 2009 and is now in his third year. He studies at the Teachers’ University on the faculty of History and Geography.  He lives with his parents and sister, who all work, and has permanent job. However, paying for education fees and covering the family’s needs becomes harder and harder each day.  For this reason, Sabuhi applied for a loan of 1800 AZN. This loan will help to pay for two years of education fees, helping him to complete his education successfully.

loans.use: to pay university fees to help him complete his studies.

loans.name: Araz

texts.en:
Araz is 42, married, and has two children. He has been breeding livestock from a very young age. Thanks to his father, who taught him the best, he already has ten years of experience. During these years, Araz has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business.

He purchase lambs and calves in the central livestock market and raises them. After fattening the animals, he resells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar.  Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma.  

His business requires a lot of physical strength, as Araz spends most of his time in the open air. His wife helps him to feed the animals. 

His monthly income is 140 AZN and Araz wishes to increase it. As meat is in high demand, he needs more capital to put into his business and cover the market.  For this purpose, he applied for 1,000 AZN. He will use the loan to buy two cattle and fodder.

loans.use: to buy two cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks,soap, and beverages for her retail business.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang is a 27-year-old, married woman who has been living in a small village of the Ornlong Veng District. She sells used clothes with her husband in a local market, earning an income of USD 3.50 each day. Sang has been in this business for almost two years.  She and her husband do not have any children yet, but they wish to have one soon.

Due to the lack of sufficient capital, Sang is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to pay for construction laborers to renovate her house. She hopes that she has a comfortable living environment after her house has been fixed.  Sang’s business goal is to own and enlarge a booth for selling clothes.

loans.use: to pay for construction laborers to renovate her house.

loans.name: Khoy

texts.en: This is Khoy’s fourth cycle loan with HKL. The purpose of this loan is to pay for the preparation of her child's wedding party, which will arrive soon. Khoy is a noble woman who always takes care of the family and educates her children to be good people living in the society. At present, Khoy is 62 years old and a mother of four children. She has become a single mother since her husband passed away in the last few years. Although she is getting older now, she still tries all of her effort to earn income. She normally goes though her commune to purchase and collect recycled materials and sells them to a local industry for profit. With the loan she has requested, Khoy hopes that it will help her to manage the wedding party well. She is very thankful to all of you who continually support her family since the beginning.

loans.use: to pay for the preparation of her child's wedding party.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,soap and beverages to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making snacks

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
This is Conchita, 59, a resident of Caloocan City. She is a dealer of beauty products. She looks for potential dealers where if she succeeds to recruit these potential dealers, she would have a commission for it. Another way is that she sells the beauty products which she gets from the distributor at a much cheaper price. She wishes to help her grandchildren in their financial needs for schooling.

In order to help her continue her work, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing this loan to buy more products from the distributor. She earns around 1,500 PHP weekly out of recruitment and selling products.

Conchita dreams to someday have enough money to renovate their house and then have land investments. She also dreams that she will have her own established outlet for her business. 



All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant products, candy, bread, drinks etc.

loans.name: Santos Camilo

texts.es: Santos Camilo de cincuenta y un años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, y tiene una gran experiencia en la agricultura siempre obtiene las mejores cosechas de la zona, es muy conocido por todos los alrededores tiene mucha clientela, debido a que lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles, Santos es un hombre servicial, trabajador y sobre todo muy humilde, piensa que con amor, esfuerzo y dedicación logrará el éxito, en esta siembra que esta por cultivar quiere aumentar la producción pero no tiene la suficiente liquidez es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz por mayor, insecticida, fertilizante y algunas herramientas de trabajo, Santos tiene la certeza que podrá obtener las ganancias necesarias para liquidar el financiamiento, nunca había tenido experiencia crediticia pero posee buenas referencias de conocidos y el apoyo de su familia; él sabe que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Santos Camilo, 50, lives with his life companion and three children in his own home. He earns a living growing corn, and has lots of farming experience. He always gets the best harvests in the area. He is well-known throughout the surrounding areas and has many customers, since what he sells is of very good qualitiy and he sells it at really accessible prices. Santos is a helpful, hardworking and above all very humble man. He believes that with love, effort and dedication he will achieve success. 

In this crop that he is about to plant he wants to increase production, but he doesn't have sufficient liquidity. So he decided to seek a loan from Integral which will allow him to purchase wholesale seed corn, insecticide, fertilizer and some work tools. Santos is certain that he will be able to make the necessary profit in order to pay off the debt. He has never had any experience with credit but he possesses good references from those who know him and the support of his family. He knows that in this way he will be able to bring financial security to his home.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale seed corn, insecticide, fertilizer, hoes and curved machetes.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline, 22, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is single. At this time she is working hard to help her family financially.

Evangeline is operating a printing business where in people come to her business to print posters, tarpaulins, and others. Her business is going well and is earning a minimum of 500 PHP daily. 

To help her continue her business operation, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to support her business and to have additional capital to supply the expenses of the business. She hopes that it would help expand her business.

Evangeline dreams to be a good business person someday and that she would someday expand her business. She also wants to help her family in their financial needs.


All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru:
Назгул  39 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. Назгул   на протяжении 20 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом, израсходованной на посев картошки. Благодаря упорному труду Назгул  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 3 коровы, земля, где она выращивает кукурузу, картофель и лук. Также, Назгул ухаживает за черешневым садом, приносящим дополнительный  доход в сезон урожая.  Продажа молока и овощей приносит Назгул около 12,000 сом в месяц. Будучи по профессии швеей, Назгул  старается передать опыт и обучает местных девушек пошиву.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку удобрений для выращивания лука.  Доходы от кредита Назгул  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Nazgul is 39 years old. She is married and bringing up four children. For 4 years, Nazgul has been growing produce and raising livestock. She launched this business with a starting capital of 5,000 KGS, which was used for planting potatoes. Thanks to Nazgul’s hard work, her farm now includes three cows and some farm land where she grows corn, potatoes and onions. Nazgul also takes care of a cherry orchard, which brings her an additional income during the harvest season. Sales of milk and vegetables bring Nazgul about 12,000 KGS monthly. Nazgul is a trained seamstress. She tries to share her experience and teaches sewing to local young women.

In order to develop her business further, Nazgul has turned to “Bai Tushum and Partners” for a loan in the amount of 70,000 KGS in order to buy fertilizers for growing onions. Nazgul plans to use the resulting revenues in expanding her farm further.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en: Phal lives in Kompong Cham province, which has an agricultural zone where local farmers grow various kinds of crops, including rice, corn, rubber trees, peppers, maize and potatoes. For the last 12 years, Phal and her husband have raised crops in this area to support themselves and their child. She is applying for a loan for KHR 1,000,000 to hire people to prepare her land and help with plowing as well as to buy potato plants. She hopes this loan will help her increase her household income and buy more land to expand her business.

loans.use: to hire people to help prepare her land, and to buy potato plants.

loans.name: Emerson

texts.es:
Emerson es un joven soltero y trabajador de 28 años. Vive en una casa alquilada y desea tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Él trabaja en el centro de salud de su localidad, desde hace 3 años. Le gusta su trabajo porque puede compartir experiencias con sus compañeros; y tiene un ingreso seguro por su labor. Lo que más anhela es poder tener su propia vivienda para establecerse. Por ello desea comprar un terreno de cultivo para laborar los fines de semana, el conoce esta actividad, por eso quiere obtener ingresos adicionales con ella.

Él es parte de un banco comunal, donde es un miembro es partícipe de las reuniones y le agrada trabajar con las personas que conforman su grupo. También se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas mensuales.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles que ahora solicita comprará un terreno con cultivos de cacao para iniciarse en esta actividad.
texts.en:
Emerson is a 28-year-old, hardworking, single man. He rents his home and is seeking better conditions. He has been working at the local health center for 3 years. He likes his work because he can share experiences with his co-workers, and it provides steady income. What he most desires is to settle in his own house. 

To do this, he wants to buy agricultural land that he can work on weekends. He knows farming and wants to increase his income this way. He is a member of a communal bank and attends the meetings. He is pleased to be working with the other group members, and he promises to make his monthly payments on time. To get this business started, he will use the loan of 2000 nuevos soles to buy land where he can grow cacao.

loans.use: to buy agricultural land.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 32 years old and lives in the Abasha District of West Georgia with her husband and four children, who range in age from one to 12 years old. Her older children attend school while her husband works on various construction projects in her village and earns about 200 Laris per month. She runs the family farm, where she has two cows which produce milk and cheese which she sells in the village. She also raises piglets, and sells about 10 of them a month. The family's total monthly income is 450 Laris.  

Maya has requested a loan to expand her dairy farm. She will buy an additional milk cow, because this will allow her to increase her output of cheese and milk by 50 percent. She and her husband hope to use the extra income to renovate their house, which is uncomfortable and in need of repair. This will allow the family to enjoy much better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel is a hardworking man who is married and the father of two children. He lives with is family in Bundibugyo, Uganda, where he is trained as a health worker and runs a drug store. The main challenges he faces in his business are price fluctuations and inadequate funds to buy drugs. His dream is to educate his children and build a permanent house for his family to live in. The main goals he has for his business are to hire employees and start up a ward where he can care for patients. He is requesting this loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Juana Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Juana  tiene 25 años y es soltera con 1 hijo que tiene la edad de un año, su actividad es el la venta de fibra textil esta fibra textil sirve como relleno para hacer almohadas, colchones y edredones su tienda se encuentran en la zona 16 de julio, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Juana va a usar este préstamo para compra de Fibra textil por mayor para luego ir vendiendo en su tienda, y de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumentar sus ingresos económicos, la Sra. Juana  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios para reinvertir en mercadería. Se deseo para su  negocio es establecer una tienda mas grande.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana is 25 years old, single, and has a one-year-old child. Her business involves selling batting fiber, which is used for stuffing pillows, mattresses, and bedspreads. Her shop is located in the July 16th District. This loan is her first cycle with Emprender.

Sra. Juana will use this loan to buy batting fiber in bulk so that she can sell it later in her shop. This will increase her operating capital. Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase her income. Sra. Juana faces challenges in her business, such as dealing with the competition. By utilizing the benefits of this loan, she will be able to reinvest in merchandise. Her wish for her business is to have a larger store.

loans.use: to purchase batting fiber in bulk.

loans.name: Casiano

texts.es:
Casiano tiene 34 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Elvira, de 30 años, y sus tres amados hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
La labor que realiza es transporte de pasajeros, moviliza a las personas que requieran de su servicio su propia localidad y con su propio motocarro. Esta actividad la empezó hace 9 años y comenta que le ha ido bien, porque ya tiene varios clientes frecuentes que le piden de su servicio para llevarlos a lugares específicos. Lo que más le gusta de su labor es que siempre tiene ingresos para el solvento de su familia, y lo dificultoso que es cuando le falla su motocarro por algún problema técnico. Es por ello que acude a MFP para solicitar un préstamo que le ayude a continuar con sus planes de trabajo, y de este modo seguir desarrollando la actividad que mejor sabe hacer.

Éste es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se siente contento por el apoyo que le brindan. Asimismo, se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago y agradece a su banco comunal, a cual se integra.
Con el préstamo solicita comprará repuestos para su motocarro y seguir laborando.
texts.en:
Casiano, age 34, lives in his own house with his 30 year old wife, Elvira, and their three beloved children.  They wish to give their children a better quality of life.

His job is passenger transportation.  He transports people who need his service.  These people are from his own area, and he uses his own “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle).  He started this business activity nine years ago.  He says that it has gone well for him.  This is because he now has various frequent customers who ask for his service to take them to specific places.

What he likes the most about is work is that he always has income to support his family.  The most difficult thing is when his motocarro does not work due to some technical problem.  That is why he comes to MFP to request a loan to help him continue with his work plans.  This way he will continue developing the business activity that he knows how to do the best.

This is his first loan with MFP, and he is happy about the support that is being given to him.  He pledges to make his payments punctually.  He is grateful to his communal bank.  He will use the requested loan to buy spare parts for his motocarrro, and he will continue working.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his "motocarro" (three wheeled motorized vehicle).

loans.name: Inés

texts.es:
Inés es una joven mujer de 22 años, vive junto a Faustino, de 33 años; y ambos tienen una casa propia donde desean tener un buen futuro.
Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 6 meses, que instaló en su misma casa, y le ha ido muy bien. Lo que más le gusta es dar una buena atención a sus clientes y verlos regresar a su tienda, pues ello le genera buenos ingresos. Para el futuro desea convertir su negocio en una tienda con ventas al por mayor; sabe que lo logrará poco a poco. Su prioridad ahora es abastecerse de mercadería para implementar en su tienda y seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Éste es su segundo préstamo con MFP y está agradecida por la oportunidad de cumplir con su trabajo.
Con los 2,500 nuevos soles que solicita comprará productos para su tienda como; galletas, arroz, fideos, conservas, gaseosas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Inés is a 22-year-old woman, who lives with 33-year-old Faustino in their own home where they hope to build a great future. Six months ago, she set up a grocery store in their home, and the business is doing well. What she loves most is serving her customers and watching them return because this generates good income for her.

In the future, she hopes to offer wholesale merchandise in her store, a dream she will achieve slowly. Her priority is to stock more merchandise in the shop and continue offering her customers good service. This is her second loan cycle with MFP, and she is grateful for the chance to carry out her work. With the loan of 2000 nuevos soles, she will buy products for the store: cookies, rice, noodles, preserves, sodas, and others.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en: Chheang is 52 years old and has raised five children, two of whom are now married and live independently in their own houses. She was born in Kompong Cham province and lives there today with her family. She earns a living by managing a farm, where she grows enough rice to provide sustenance and a suitable income for her family. Her husband works as an electronics repair person, providing services to people who live in his area. Chheang has come to HKL for her second loan, for KHR 1,000,000, to stock her husband's shop with televisions and electronic spare parts. She hopes that this loan will allow her to improve her family's living conditions, and wants to express her gratitude for the help she is receiving from HKL and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy televisions and electronic spare parts for her husband’s shop.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio, vive con su familia conformada por su esposa y tres hijos de 19, 16 y 14 años de edad, todos dependen de él, se dedica a las actividades agropecuarias, sembrando maíz y crianza de ganado, sus actividades diarias comienzan a las 5:00am para ordeñar las vacas, luego se dispone a trabajar en la siembra y cuido de maíz y frijol, regresando a su hogar a las 4:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como la compra de abono, insecticidas, y pago de mano de obra, esta compra le ayudara a tener lo necesario para su milpa y poder mejorar sus cosechas libres de plagas, su riego en el cultivo son los cambios climáticos.
El objetivo de Lucio es mejorar la producción pues esto ayudara a incrementar los ingresos económicos que le permitirá darles a su familia la alimentación necesaria y la educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucio lives with his family, which consists of his wife and three children (ages 19, 16, and 14), all of whom are dependent on him. He engages in farming activities, such as growing corn and raising cattle. His daily activities begin at 5am, which is when he milks the cows. Later on he works in the fields, caring for his crops of corn and beans. He returns home at 4pm.

Lucio is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies, such as compost and insecticides, and to pay for labor. This will help provide what he needs for his farm so that he can improve his harvest and keep his crops free of pests. The risk to his crops is the changing weather. Lucio's goal is to improve his production, which will increase his earnings and allow him to provide food for his family and an education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase compost and insecticides and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Máximo

texts.es:
Máximo un joven trabajador de 24 años, vive en su casa propia, junto a su pareja Dévora, de 20 años. 
Él se dedica a la construcción, empezó a trabajar en eso hace 9 meses. Cada mañana se levanta muy temprano para realizar su labor. Para él es muy importante su trabajo, ya que anhela en ser un gran albañil y trabajando en grandes construcciones. Para esto tiene la compañía de otros jornaleros quienes se ganan la vida con su mano de obra. 

Éste es su segundo préstamo con MFP y está contento por el apoyo financiero que le brindan, ya que así puede cumplir con su objetivo. En su banco comunal agradece a las personas que le dieron esta oportunidad.
Con el préstamo que solicita comprará madera, alambres, clavos y otros, para terminar de construir su casa, así como algunas herramientas para su trabajo.
texts.en:
Maximo is a hardworking youth of 24 years.  He lives in his own home with his partner, Devora, who is 20.

Maximo works in construction; he started doing this work 9 months ago.  He gets up very early every morning to start his work.  For him, the work is very important, because he wants to become a great builder and work on large construction projects.  On the job, he is accompanied by other workers who want to earn a living through their labor.

This is his second loan with MFP, and he is pleased with the financial support that they are providing him, because in this way he is able to accomplish his goals.  He is grateful to the people in his communal bank who gave him this opportunity.

With the loan that he requests, he will buy wood, wire, nails and other construction materials to finish building his house.  He will also buy some tools for his job.

loans.use: to finish construction on his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of green and yellow bananas to sell

loans.name: C 1683 Turwanyubukene Group

texts.en: Charles is 54 years old, married and the father of six children who range in age from 8 to 14 years old. He is also the leader of a loan group called " C 1683 Turwanyubukene," which means "Fight Poverty." In the photograph, Charles is the first person on the right. For the last 30 years, he has earned a living by growing potatoes, and now employs four people to help him on his farm. He has requested a loan to grow larger quantities of potatoes to sell. With the additional profit made possible by this loan, Charles will be able to buy more food for his family and pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to grow a larger potato crop.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 28 years old and is single and he takes care of 1 relative. He sells various goods such as: cooking oil, soap, plastic shoes, rice, biscuits etc. and he has three years of experience in this business. Leonard currently employs five people to help him.

Leonidas has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as: cooking oil, soap, plastic shoes, rice, biscuits etc. to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, and he will be able to build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as: cooking oil, soap, plastic shoes, rice, biscuits etc. to sell.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang is 57 years old and a humble villager from Kompong Cham province. She has been residing there with her husband and two single children, while the other three children are living separately around the provinces. Being a good mother, Neang has a commitment to work out her plan and provide her children a comfortable living condition. She works tirelessly in the field from dawn to dusk to ensure a fruitful harvest. She grows rice, potatoes, maize and beans based on the season. She has been engaged in the crop farming business for ages. 

She is now asking for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, seeds, and to pay for a tractor to till her land. She believes that she will attain a better standard of living through her efforts and patience. She thanks in advance our lenders who kindly support her in growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, seeds, and to pay for a tractor to till her land.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana es una joven soltera de 26 años, vive en su casa propia y trabaja por tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en una tienda que implementó en su vivienda. Los productos que ofrece le brindan un buen ingreso económico, pues son los más necesarios en todo hogar, y además ella atiende amablemente a sus clientes. Le gusta su trabajo porque puede conversar con sus clientes sobre sus experiencias; por otro lado, considera que lo más difícil es la falta de algunos productos que se agotan rápidamente.

Éste es su segundo préstamo con MFP. En su banco comunal está muy agradecida con las personas que le bridan apoyo para continuar con su trabajo.
Con los 500 nuevos soles que solicita podrá abastecerse de mercadería para implementar en su tienda.
texts.en:
Roxana is a 26 year-old single woman who lives in her own house and works to have a better quality of life.

She has been selling groceries from a store that she set up in her house for 4 years.  The products that she sells bring her a good income, because they are all household necessities.  Also, she provides friendly service to her customers.  She enjoys her work because she can chat with her customers about their experiences.  However, what she finds most difficult about the work is that she often lacks certain products that she runs out of quickly.  

This is her second loan with MFP.  She is very grateful to the people in her communal bank that have provided her support so that she can continue with her work.  With the 500 Peruvian soles that she requests, she will be able to stock up on merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more gold to sell and purchase additional stock to sell at her retail business.

loans.name: El Control  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Control está formado por 9 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por una comunidad perteneciente a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, lugar que es conocido como el mirador ya que desde lo alto se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y comercio, muchos laboran en la ciudad realizando varias actividades. Nuestras socia son personas amables, gentiles y luchadoras ya que siempre están en la búsqueda de mejores ingresos en sus hogares para salir  adelante con sus familias, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Carmita, vive por la comunidad de Punta Corral en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca,  tiene 41 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos, dos de sus hijos son casados, dos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente y sus cuatro hijos últimos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo presta sus servicios como guardia de seguridad, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de familiares.
 
Doña Carmita se dedica al cuidado de su hogar ya que sus hijos aun son pequeños y necesitan de su cuidado, como pasa en casa tiene un criadero de cuyes.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace dos años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos para inicializarse en la cría de estos animales. 

Su meta es crecer en el negocio de cría de animales.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Control comprises 10 members who live in a community in Turi parish in Cuenca. It is known as the viewpoint because from the highest part you can see most of the city of Cuenca. The residents raise livestock, farm, and work in businesses; many of them work in the city at various activities. Our members are kind, charming, and hardworking people, who are always seeking more household income to support their families, while maintaining their culture and traditions.

Carmita, one of the group members, lives in Punta Corral on the outskirts of Cuenca.  She is 41 years old, married, and has 8 children from her marriage.  Two of the children are married; two work and help her financially; and the youngest four children attend school in the city. Her husband is a security guard. They do not have their own home, so they live with other family members. 

Carmita takes care of the house, since her children are still young and need her care. She raises guinea pigs at home. She has been a member of the communal bank for two years. She will use this loan to buy pigs to get started raising and selling these animals. Her goal is to grow this business.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana tiene 28 años, vive con Edwin, de 30 años, y su hijo Joel de un añito. La casa donde habitan es propia.
Se dedica a labrar la tierra, cultiva cacao y café. La cosecha de estas plantas las lleva a comercializar a los centros de acopio de su localidad, donde le gratifican muy bien por cada kilo que vende. En los tiempos que cosecha lo hace junto a su esposo y jornaleros que contrata, para que se extraigan los frutos de manera más rápida.
Para el futuro desea ampliar su parcela, pero por ahora lo más importante es realizar el mantenimiento de los cultivos que ya tiene.

Éste es su primer crédito con MFP, y se siente contenta por saber que contará con el apoyo financiero. Así también, se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago, y agradece a sus compañeros de banco comunal, donde acaba de ingresar, por la confianza.
Con el préstamo de 1,500 nuevos soles que solicita comprará abono para esparcir en sus plantas.
texts.en:
Susana, 28, lives with Edwin, 30, and their son Joel, who is a 1 year-old baby.  They own the house that they live in.

Susana works the land, farming cocoa and coffee.  She takes the harvested products to sell in the collection centers in her town, where they pay very well for each kilo that she sells.  At harvest times, she works alongside her husband and some farmhands that she hires, so that they can extract the fruit in a very rapid manner.  

In the future she wants to cultivate a bigger parcel of land, but for now, what is most important is to maintain the crops that she already has. 

This is her first loan with MFP, and she feels content to know that she will be able to count on financial support.  In addition, she promises to be punctual with her payments.  She appreciates the members of the communal bank that she just joined, for giving her their trust.  With the 1,500 Peruvian soles that she requests, she will buy fertilizer to spread on her crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan is a 29-year-old, single man.  He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Elshan has bred cattle, sheep, and cows for last eight years. He did not attend university, but instead decided to start his business.  He receives 50 AZN monthly in financial support from the government, but this not enough to cover his family’s needs.

Elshan usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for about five to six months and then resells them for a profit in the livestock bazaar. His brother helps him to look after the cattle.  Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes. Elshan also keeps milk cows for personal use and to sell milk products to neighbors.  

Elshan’s monthly income is 100 AZN and the cattle business is his main source of income. He applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase one cow and seven sheep. He wants to expand his business and improve the conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy one cow and seven sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of green bananas and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Fortunee

texts.en:
Fortunee is 33 years old and married with two children between three and five years old.  She currently employs two people to help her.  She sells  various goods, including lotion, powder, soap, Colgate and plastic shoes.  She has been in this business for four years. 

Fortunee has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase various goods to sell.  With the profits, she will be able to save for her future and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: purchase goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Erla Veronica

texts.es:
Erla, vive con su hijo de tres años de edad y su esposo que trabaja en la fuerza armada, ella se dedica a atender una tienda de víveres, este negocio nació por necesidad de poder mejorar sus ingresos y suplir algunas necesidades familiares.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para la tienda: aceite, pastas, embutidos, galletas, dulces, boquitas, gaseosas, jabón y detergentes, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar la disponibilidad en el negocio, ofreciendo mayor variedad a los clientes.
El objetivo de Erla es mejorar su vivienda, a través del desarrollo en el negocio, con mejores ventas que le aumenten su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Erla lives with her three-year-old son and her husband who is in the armed forces. She manages a general store, a business that she started out of necessity because she needed to improve her income and provide for some her family's needs.

Erla is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise for her store such as oil, pastas, sausages, cookies, sweets, snack foods, sodas, soap, and detergents. This loan will help to improve the availability of products in her business so that she can offer a wider variety to her customers. Erla's goals are to improve her home, develop her business, and improve her sales in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Higuerón  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En un sitio llamado Higuerón en la ciudad de Portoviejo  cada quince días se reúnen las 20 sociass del Banco Comunal  Higuerón. Las mismas que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, comercio en general, entre otras actividades. Ellas al conocer de los beneficios que brinda la institución decidieron unirse  hace un tiempo atrás para poder acceder a los créditos que brinda La Fundación Espoir.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Victoria, ella tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de  esta  relación tienen una niña de 1 año  de edad. Su esposo es cocinero.

Nuestra amiga con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días en las mañanas ya que a esa hora su suegra se queda con su pequeña hija, ella deja a crédito sus prendas  y cobra cada quince días.  Compra su mercadería  en  Guayaquil cada vez que tiene pedidos. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos ciclos, es la presidenta del grupo  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos para seguir con su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.

La foto pequeña es de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
Every two weeks in a place called Higuerón in the city of Portoviejo, 20 members of the communal bank Higuerón meet. The members work at a variety of activities such as farming, general business, and others.When they learned about the benefits of the institution, they decided to form a group to access the loans offered by La Fundación Espoir.   

Here we meet Victoria. She is 25, married, and has a year-old daughter from this marriage. Her husband is a cook. Our friend wants to earn some money herself so that she can help meet the household expenses.She sells all types of clothing door-to-door and from a small space in her home. She works every morning while her mother-in-law cares for her daughter. She sells clothing on credit and collects every two weeks. When she has orders, she buys the merchandise in Guayaquil. She has been selling clothing for three years, and the business is doing well.

She will use this loan to buy merchandise like pants, blouses, shirts, and children's apparel. She has been a member of the communal bank for two loan cycles and is the president. She likes that the loans allow her to keep her business going. Her dream is to own her own house, as the one where she lives is a rental. The inset photo is of two members who couldn't be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's apparel.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente est entrepreneur, leader d’association d’affaire Upatanisho, âgée de 49 ans, mariée, mère de 9 enfants dont certains ont leurs propres foyers et  d’autres vont encore à l’école. Son mari est chômeur. La  cliente est vendeuse d’huile de palme, l’huile végétal raffiné Rina et autres épisses. Elle expose ses marchandises au long de la rue et parfois à son domicile. Bientôt 8 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle démarra son activité avec le crédit reçu de l’IMF Hekima vers 2004. Les profits de son activité lui servent d’épargner, de soins de santé, d’aimantation et de petits investissements. Ce nouveau  crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouvelles marchandises (3 bidons d’huile de palme,  2 cartons d’huile raffiné Rina, 3 sacs de farines, tomates, soja, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise et construire dignement une belle maison pour  sa famille. La cliente  remercie l’IMF Hekima et ses partenaires pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The client is an entrepreneur and leader of the Upatanisho business association. She is 49 years old, married, and mother of 9 children, some of whom live in their own homes and some of whom are still in school. Her husband is unemployed. She sells palm oil, Rina refined vegetable oil, and various spices. She displays her goods on the side of the road, and sometimes from her home.

She has been in business for almost eight years now. She started her business with the loan she received from the MFI, Hekima, around 2004. The profit from her business allows her to save, receive medical treatment, buy food, and make small investments.

This new loan will allow her to stock up on new goods (3 cans of palm oil, 2 containers of Rina refined oil, 3 bags of flour, tomatoes, soya, etc.). She is also striving to expand her business and build a beautiful house for her family.

She would like to thank Hekima and its partners for all they do to help poor women excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 3 cans of palm oil, 2 containers of Rina refined oil, 3 bags of flour, tomatoes, soya, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Martha Iris

texts.es:
Martha Iris, tiene 26 años de edad, vive en una colonia suburbana del municipio de San Pedro Sula junto a su pareja y su hija de 3 años de edad.
Su actividad económica es una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como granos básicos, lácteos, refrescos, carnes, algunos artículos para el hogar y otros. Este negocio lo estableció desde hace año y medio después de haber trabajado en una maquila, ella decidió por  su propio negocio y así atender a su familia también. Esta solicitando un préstamo de L.10,000.00 para surtir el negocio de productos de la canasta básica familiar, siendo esta su fuente de ingresos de donde ayuda al hogar. Ella esta alegre por el apoyo brindado ya que podrá ayudar más a su familia.
texts.en:
Martha Iris is 26 years old and lives in a suburban section of the town of San Pedro Sula along with her partner and her three-year-old daughter. Her business is a grocery store where she sells food such as basic grains, dairy products, soft drinks, meats, a few household goods, and other items. This business was established a year and a half ago after she stopped working at a factory. She decided to start her own business so that she could also attend to her family.

Martha is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL so that she can restock her business with basic everyday products since her store is the source of income by which she can support her household. She is pleased with the assistance that has been provided so that she can help her family even more.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, soft drinks, meat, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Sunheang's Group

texts.en:
A widow living in the rural area of the Ponhea Krek district, Sunheang is 52 years old and she has only one son. She has struggled her life to feed the family by planting cassava and selling duck eggs in the village. She has been in this business for almost ten years.

Sunheang's group consists of two female members living in the same village. She and her group member have been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund for two loan cycles already and they successfully paid back the loans which have helped them improve their living standard. Now Sunheang can earn up to 63,000 KHR from her current business to support the family. Now requesting a loan with VisionFund, Sunheang, who is the group leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rafaela Maria

texts.es: La  señora Rafaela es originaria de un poblado del departamento de león, su profesión es maestra de educación Primaria, actualmente está impartiendo clases en el colegio de la zona de Telica de la que tiene  26 años de ejercer dicha actividad, su núcleo familiar está compuesto por  6  hijo,  los que estudian en colegios de la localidad, actualmente solicito el crédito para mejorar su vivienda con la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cerámica, Cemento y Mano de Obra. Para mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida con ese objetivo se acerco a ceprodel para continuar solicitando financiamiento y cumplir con su sueño, ya que los créditos recibidos le han sido de gran impacto en mejoramiento mismo de ella y su hijo, ya que mejorara el piso de su vivienda el que está en mal estado.
texts.en:
Rafaela is from a village in the León department.  She is an elementary school teacher.  She is currently teaching at a school in the Telica area, and she has been teaching for 26 years.  Her family is comprised of six children, and they attend the local schools.

She is currently requesting a loan to improve her house.  She will buy construction materials like tiles and cement.  She will also pay for the labor.  In order to improve her living conditions and her standard of living she went to Ceprodel to continue requesting a loan to fulfill her dream.  The loans that she has received have had a great impact on bettering herself and her children.  She will improve the floor of her house, which is in a bad state.

loans.use: to improve the floor of her house by purchasing cement and tile and to pay  for the labor.

loans.name: Pedro Julio

texts.es: El Sr. Pedro  vive en la zona de chinchaya que está ubicada a cuarenta minutos del centro de la ciudad. En esta localidad los Comunarios se dedican a la crianza de vacas lecheras y al sembradío de verduras en el caso de las mujeres y los hombres al lavado de arena y piedra para construcción que sacan del rio. El Sr. Pedro vive acá toda su vida y antes se dedicaba a lavar arena pero como ya es un poco mayor de edad ahora trababa realizando el mantenimiento en el cementerio de mascotas. Él llegó a nuestra institución gracias a su hijo Eusebio quien lo recomendó para que trabaje con préstamos, el Sr.  Pedro es una persona alegre y muy trabajadora y solicita el préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento del cementerio de mascotas, ya que su trabajo consiste principalmente en cavar nuevas tumbas para mascotas y hacer que el lugar siempre se vea limpio, y esto implica un gasto en lo que es la compra de herramientas e insumos de aseo, el Sr. Pedro se encuentra agradecido con la institución ya que en anterior crédito le fue muy bien con la compra de herramientas.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro lives in the District of Chinchaya, which is located 40 minutes away from the central part of the city. In this area, the residents raise dairy cattle. The women are in charge of planting vegetables while the men wash sand and stones taken from the river so that they can be used for construction.

Sr. Pedro has lived in this area his entire life. He previously had a job washing sand, but now that he is a bit older, his current job involves maintaining a pet cemetery. Pedro came to Emprender thanks to his son Eusebio, who recommended that he take advantage of the loans.

Sr. Pedro is a cheerful and hardworking person. He is requesting a loan to pay for maintenance of the pet cemetery. His work consists primarily of digging new pet graves and making sure the place is always kept clean, which has associated expenses such as the purchase of equipment and cleaning supplies. Sr. Pedro is grateful to Emprender for his previous loan, which he utilized successfully by purchasing tools.

loans.use: to buy equipment and cleaning supplies for performing maintenance and repairs around the pet cemetery.

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is 34 years old and is married with two children aged 7 and 12 years old. She takes care of 3 relatives. She purchases and sells various goods such as: cakes, lotions, Colgate, soap, etc.

Beatha has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as: cakes, lotions, Colgate, soap, etc. to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, she will be able to pay school fees for her children and she will be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as: cakes, lotions, Colgate, soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica es una joven madre de 25 años, vive junto a Gabriel, de 27 años. Su casa es propia, y tienen una pequeña bebé, quien es el motivo de alegría y a quien desean brindarle un buen futuro.
Su labor está en los campos de cultivo, siembra cacao. Desde muy temprano, junto a su pareja, realizan los trabajos agrícolas como; labrar la tierra, esparcir el abono, desyerbar las malezas, etc. Esta labor la lleva realizando desde hace 6 años y asegura que le ha ido muy bien en las cosechas, ya que puede venderlas a muy buen precio por ser de buena calidad. 
Para el fututo, desea ampliar su parcela para obtener aun más producción de cacao.

Éste es su crédito número 4 con MFP, por tanto está agradecida por la colaboración que le brindan para seguir cumpliendo con su trabajo. Asimismo, le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal, ya que todos son muy responsables.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles que ahora solicita comprará abono y fertilizantes para esparcir en su parcela.
texts.en:
Yessica is a 25-year old mother who lives with her 27-year old husband Gabriel. They live in their own house. Their little baby daughter is their pride and joy, and they wish to provide her with a good future. 

Yessica works in agriculture growing cocoa. She and her husband leave the house very early to work in the fields: tilling the ground, spreading fertilizer, weeding etc. They’ve been doing this for the last six years, and Yessica says that the harvests have been good. She’s sold the crop for a good price because of the high quality. In the future she wishes to obtain more land so she can increase production. 

This will be her fourth loan with MFP, and she is very grateful to everyone who helps her continue farming. She also appreciates being a member of her community bank as all the members are responsible people. 

With the S/. 2,000 loan, she will buy manure and fertilizer to spread on her land.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Mavlina

texts.en:
Mavlina is 64 years old.  She lives in a village in the Khoni District of West Georgia.  Mavlina is a widow, and lives with her daughter, son-in-law and two grandchildren.  Mavlina is a pensioner.  Her daughter is a teacher at the local school.  Mavlina is running the family's agricultural business.  They have a dairy farm with five milk cows.  Mavlina produces and sells an average of 60 kg of traditional West-Georgian cheese each month.  She sells it at the local open market.  In addition to the cows, they have a pig on the farm and sell an average of 12 piglets each year.  Mavlina’s son-in-law is an investigator and gets a monthly salary.  The family's total average monthly income is 1200 Laris.

Mavlina requested credit for purchasing a mini tractor.  She will rent it in the village to gain additional income.  There is quite a high demand for tractors in agricultural areas, especially in the spring season.  She plans to use the additional income to purchase household goods and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: purchase a mini tractor.

loans.name: Sokhen's Group

texts.en:
Sokhen is 33 years old and married. She lives in a village located in the Ponhea Krek district and has two dependent children, one daughter and one son. Her daughter is still in school. To make a living, Sokhen and her husband have been farming rice and planting cassava to support a living for almost 13 years. 

This is Sokhen's group, which consists of three female members, and they all have been with VisionFund for two loan cycles. The past loans have helped Sokhen to make a better living with sufficient food to eat. Having successfully paid back the loans with VisionFund, Sokhen and her group members are requesting a loan of 1,400,000 Khmer Riel each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for farmland and pay for labor. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield with good quality and sell for a good price so as to earn a bigger income for the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sisters Of Destiny Group

texts.en:
Members of the Sisters Of Destiny group are pictured in the photo. The members are small-scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan that these entrepreneurs have received from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profits and consequently improve their standards of living. 

The leader of this group is Sallamatu. She was born in Tankoro, which is in eastern Sierra Leone. Sallamatu is 38 years old, married to a driver and has four children with her husband – two in primary school and two in secondary school. 

Sallamatu has been selling firewood and charcoal for thirteen years. With this loan, she will buy firewood and charcoal at wholesale prices in order to sell retail to her customers.

(The photo also includes loan officer Edward. He is handing the loan over to the borrowers).

loans.use: to buy firewood and charcoal at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Dulce Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité Dulce Esperanza  se formó con la unión de 16 vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.  Ellas se unieron ya que quieren ayudar a sus familias gracias a esta oportunidad que le da la fundación de formar un grupo de compañeras.
La Señora Demetria es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la costura y decoración de eventos, es una señora muy trabajadora, creativa, activa  y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.  Ella tiene  5 hijos y su marido es electricista. Nos cuenta que ella y su marido siempre se esfuerzan por poder darle a su familia lo que necesitan, y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones.
La señora Demetria solicita el crédito para la compra de telas y materiales para su decoración, ya que son los principales elementos que usa para su trabajo.
texts.en:
The “Dulce Esperanza” (Sweet Hope) committee formed when 16 neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso joined together wanting to help their families by means of this opportunity the Fundación is giving them to form a group of companions.

Demetria is one of the committee members.  She works as a seamstress and as an events decorator.  She’s a very hardworking, creative, active woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She has five children and her husband’s an electrician.  She tells us that she and her husband always strive to be able to give their family what they need and so that they won’t have to go through any privations.

Demetria asks for the loan to buy fabric and decorations because they are the main things she uses for her work.

loans.use: to buy fabric and decorations.

loans.name: Ynes

texts.es:
Ynes tiene 46 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y amable. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Hernán, de 46 años, y sus cinco queridos hijos, quienes son el principal motivo de sus esfuerzos.
Ella se dedica a la venta de combustible con la ayuda de su esposo. Tienen un grifo al servicio de su localidad, el cual es uno de los más recurridos, pues conocen a Ynes y el buen trato y carisma que posee. Estas características, junto al combustible y los otros productos, de buena calidad, que ofrece es lo que la hicieron una de las preferidas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, y luego de 3 años de labor, considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer durante todo el día y noche con su trabajo. Para más adelante espera incrementar los productos de su negocio como son; el combustible, aceites para carro, entre otros.

Éste es su crédito número 7 con MFP y está dispuesta a seguir pagando sus cuotas con puntualidad. En su banco comunal es participe en todas las reuniones que se realizan.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles que solicita podrá incrementar los productos que vende en su grifo.
texts.en:
Ynes, 46, is a very hardworking and kind woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband Hernán, 46, and her five beloved children, who are the main motivation for her efforts.

She sells fuel with the help of her husband.  They have a gas station to serve their town.  It is one of the busiest ones because they know Ynes and her good treatment and charisma.  These characteristics together with the fuel and other good-quality products she sells are what made her one of the favorites.

What she likes most about her job is talking with her customers.  After three years of work she considers the most difficult thing to be having to stay with her job all day and night.  For the future she hopes to increase the products in her business, which are fuel, motor oil, and others.

This is her seventh loan with MFP and she is ready to continue making her payments on time.  She participates in all the meetings in her communal bank.

With the 3,000 nuevos soles [PEN] that she is requesting, she will be able to increase the products she sells in her gas station.

loans.use: to increase the merchandise in her gas station.

loans.name: Abdul A.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of secondary school teachers, from Kenema city located in eastern Sierra Leone.  They have come to SMT to request a loan of 4,900,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to improve their standards of living.  At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting their repayment amount and paying SMT.  

Abdul is the leader of this group.  He is 47 years old and was born in Lunsar town located in northern Sierra Leone.  He is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for 22 years now.  Abdul is married and has two children, one in secondary school and the other in college.  Abdul has requested this loan in order to buy building materials including bags of cement and corrugated iron for the construction of a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials including bags of cement and corrugated iron for the construction of a house for his family.

loans.name: Foday T.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from a secondary school in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone.  These teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, in order to seek a loan of 4,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) to meet their immediate financial challenges.  At the end of each month, they repay the loan using their monthly salaries.  The bursar at their school is directly responsible for making the repayment on their behalf.

Foday is the leader of this group.  Born in Buedu village in eastern Sierra Leone, Foday is married to a trader and the couple has four children.  Foday has been a professional teacher for 10 years now.  He has requested this loan in order to buy building materials like corrugated iron, sand, cement, rods, nails, etc. to use to construct a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials like corrugated iron, sand, cement, rods, nails, etc. to use to construct a house for his family.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 19-year-old single Lebanese man living with his parents and two siblings. Hussein and his father are able to provide a fair standard of living for their family. Hussein started to work as a painter in 2009. He works on a free-lance basis. He is considered friendly, especially by his loyal customers. Today, he’s requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. He will use the loan to purchase additional painting supplies for his business, in order to be able to handle a new project. This Kiva loan will open a new door for him to take on bigger projects and increase his productivity by 30%. In the future, he plans to open his own painting supplies shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional painting supplies

loans.name: Sara's Group

texts.en:
Living in a village located in the Tbaung Khmum district, Sara is a 60-year-old mother of three children: two daughters and one son. Rice farming and a cassava plantation are the family's main source of income. They have been in this business for almost 40 years. 

Having successfully repaid loans from VisionFund, Sara feels empowered and confident to make her living. With her current business, her daily income has increased up to 21,900 KHR after her first loan from VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of four members, who have been with VisionFund for one to two loan cycles, to apply for another loan from VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her business to prosper and enable her to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 42-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four school-aged children. He’s working really hard to be able to pay his children’s educational fees. He has been working in construction for the past eleven years. He’s a reputable person and well known for his professionalism at work. Today, he wants to borrow a loan from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more construction tools for his business. This kiva loan will allow him to carry on his work as it should be and start his new project. In the future, he plans to take on more projects inside and outside the country.

loans.use: to purchase more construction tools for his business

loans.name: Said

texts.en: Said is a 33-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and one child. He strives to work really hard with the cooperation of his wife in order to enrich their way of living and cover the heavy costs of life. Said began his own work as a painter in 2004 and already has many years of experience in this domain. He has gained different clients from different areas especially because of his good and well organized work. Today, he’s requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new painting tools and brushes for his business in order to gain more customers and thus higher income. In the future, he plans to open his own painting shop.

loans.use: to purchase new painting tools and brushes for his business

loans.name: Junta De Saneamiento Loma Grande Group

texts.es:
La junta de saneamiento Loma Grande se formó en vistas a la mejora del estilo de vida de una de las comunidades de la ciudad de Caacupé.
Los encargados nos comentan que están muy contentos con lo que hacen, ya que gracias a esta aguatería es posible que las personas aledañas a esta puedan tener acceso a algo tan imprescindible como es el agua.
El deseo de todos ellos es poder seguir ampliando y mejorando las condiciones de su servicio, para que de esta forma mas personas sean beneficiadas. Solicitan el crédito para la renovación de los soportes del motor del pozo principal, para que de esa forma los servicios que dan a sus usuarios no tengan problemas. Agradecen por la gran ayuda que están recibiendo por parte de la fundación y de Kiva.
texts.en:
The Sanitation Board of Loma Grande was established with the intention of improving the lifestyle of one of the communities of Caacupé’s city.The people in charge are very satisfied with what they do, since thanks to this aqueduct people from the surroundings can have access to something as essential as water. 

The desire of all of them is to continue expanding and improving the conditions of the service, so that more people benefit. They request the loan to renew the engine mounts of the main well, so that the services given to the users don’t have problems. 

They are grateful for the big help that they are receiving from the field partner	Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: to renew the engine mounts of the main well

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El comité  Santa Librada se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad Santaní, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras. Todas ellas se dedican a la cría de animales de corral, como ser cerdos, gallinas, patos y demás.
Una de estas mujeres es Ana, quien es la presidenta del grupo, ella constantemente motiva a sus compañeras a poder seguir luchando y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familias. Ella es una persona entusiasta y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados con los que podrá abastecer su stock y de esa forma poder tener siempre con que alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
The Santa Librada Committee was formed through the union of various neighbors in the city of Santaní. All of the members are extremely hardworking, entrepreneurial women, and all of them work raising corral animals, such as pigs, chickens, ducks and other animals.

One of the group members is Ana, and she is the president of the group. She is constantly motivating her fellow group members to continue working hard and to provide for their families. She is a very enthusiastic person with a strong desire to work hard and get ahead in life. 

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase feed her animals and be able to store up food for them so they will not go hungry.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 23-year-old Lebanese married woman.  She lives with her husband and only child.  She has been selling clothes from her home since 2009, and is helping her husband by bringing in additional income so they can offer their child a better future.  Her husband has been working with a local company since 2008.  Today, she is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more clothing with new designs and accessories.  This loan will help to increase her sales.  In the future, she plans to open her own clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jenny Tatiana

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Sultana se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar vive la señora Jenny, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 4 hijos, ella fue madre muy joven pues tuvo su primer hijo a la edad de 13 años el mismo que hoy tiene  10 años, sus otros hujos tienen 8, 6  y 1 año y medio de edad, los tres mayores  estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 

Ella para  ayudar a su esposo realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de pescado pero al por mayor, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que él se desplaza cuatro veces por semana a las playas de Manta y Santa Rosa lugar donde compra buen pescado directamente a los pescadores, con esto compra más barato y de lo mejor, para luego llevar la carga al mercado y distribuirlo a los comerciantes minoristas de la ciudad. Lleva más de 13 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pescado. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y a muy bajo interés.
 
Su sueño es comprar un camión ya que hasta ahora cada vez que su esposo viaja tiene que fletar un carro y esto se le lleva parte de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “La Sultana” meets every fifteen days in the canton of Jipijapa, a canton known as “La Sultana del Café” because of its extensive fields of incomparably flavored coffee, its cuisine, and for the warmth of its people.

This is where Jenny, 23, lives.  She is in a common-law relationship and has four children from this relationship. She was a very young mother, having her first child when she was 13 years old; that child is now  aged 10. The other children are 8, 6, and 1½.  The three oldest children are studying in school.  Her husband is a merchant. 

In order to help her husband, she will use this loan for his business.  He makes his living selling fish wholesale. Our friend Jenny tells us that he travels four times a week to the beaches of Manta and Santa Rosa where he buys good fish directly from the fisherman and in this way he can purchase the cheapest and the best fish.  He then takes the fish to the market and distributes them to the retailers in the city.  He has spent more than 13 years making his living this way and he does very well. 

She will use this loan to buy fish.  She has been a member of the communal bank for two years and enjoys it because the loans are quick and have a low interest rate. 

Her dream is to buy a truck because so far every time her husband travels she has to hire a car and this takes away from their earnings.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María es socia del Bancomunal Sarita, es viuda y madre de 4 hijos. Ella está agradecida con la institución por todo el apoyo que le han brindado todo este tiempo y sobre todo en los momentos en que más lo necesitaba como cuando falleció su esposo y también en la educación de sus hijos. Se dedica a la venta productos de loza como vasos, platos, jarras, cucharas en diferentes mercados y ferias de manera ambulatoria. Le gusta mucho asistir a las reuniones de su Bancomunal ya que ahí aprende temas motivadores los cuales aplica tanto en su vida personal como laboral. Su meta es terminar de construir su vivienda. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de productos de loza para  surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Communal Bank "Sarita".  She is 47 years old, widowed, and the mother of four children.  María has been with FINCA Peru for 10 years.  She is grateful to FINCA for all of the support that it has provided this entire time, especially in those moments when she needed it the most, such as when her husband died and also when she needed to pay for her children's education.  María sells dishware such as glasses, plates, pitchers, and spoons at different markets and fairs as a traveling vendor.  She enjoys attending the Communal Bank meetings because she learns about motivational topics that apply to her personal life and to her work.  Her goal is to finish the construction of her home.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of dishware so that she can restock her business.

loans.use: to buy dishware.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga es socia del Bancomunal Sarita, tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un pequeño hijo; es socia de FINCA Perú hace 6 meses. Se dedica a la venta de verduras en general al por mayor en el mercado. Ella está feliz de pertenecer a su Bancomunal, allí conoció muchas amigas con las que conversan sobre sus situaciones de la vida. Le gusta mucho las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal ya que ellas le enseñaron a ser responsable y a no ser pesimista ante cualquier adversidad de la vida. Su meta es tener un puesto propio en el mercado. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de verduras al por mayor para venderlas en el mercado.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Communal Bank "Sarita".  She is 28 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has a young son.  Olga has been with FINCA Peru for six months.  She sells vegetables wholesale at the market.  Olga is pleased to be part of her Communal Bank, where she knows many of her friends and gets to talk about their situations in life.  She greatly enjoys the training classes offered by her Communal Bank because they have taught her how to be responsible and to avoid pessimism when faced with any adversity in life.  Her goal is to acquire her own vending post at the market.  

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of vegetables in bulk so that she can sell them at the market.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es: Rosa Elvira de veinticinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella posee una pupusería y una venta de desayunos es muy conocida pues elabora los platillos más deliciosos del lugar: frijoles en sus diversas formas de prepararse, plátanos, huevos, pupusas en variedad entre otros, tiene varios años de experiencia y es  muy buena cocinando y vendiendo, las personas la prefieren por la calidad, el higiene y los buenos precios, le ha traído muy buenas ganancias y quiere realizar una nueva inversión, por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima, maíz, frijoles, queso, embutidos, huevos, verduras, entre algunos otros ingredientes a fin de variar su menú. Rosa es una mujer emprendedora con muchas metas por alcanzar, su más grande secreto es el amor a la labor, tiene muy buenas referencias crediticias y es muy responsable por eso esta segura que saldará su deuda con éxito, y al mismo tiempo le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira, 25, lives with her life partner and children.  She sells pupusas [stuffed tortillas] and breakfasts.  She is very well known because she makes the most delicious dishes in the area: beans in various forms of preparation, plantains, and a variety of pupusas, among others.  She has several years of experience and is very good at cooking and selling.  People prefer her for the quality, the cleanliness, and the good prices.
