Thelma works hard to support her family. She requested a loan to purchase a fishing boat and nets. She hopes this loan will help increase the profitability of her and her husband's business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat and nets.

loans.name: Maselina

texts.en: Maselina is a 47-year-old married woman with seven children. She plans to start a business selling a variety of household products. She has requested a loan to start a new store. Masekina will use her profits to expand the store. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy stock for the store.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida operates a farm for a living. She works with her husband to till their land and plant rice crops to sell. Zenaida has six children, four of whom are school-aged. 

Zenaida works hard to improve her family's income. She requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor. Zenaida hopes to increase her income so that she can pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 59-year-old married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a farmer, and she primarily grows rice crops to sell. She uses her income to purchase basic necessities for her family. 

Nida needs additional capital to keep her farm productive. She plans to purchase farm supplies, such as seeds and fertilizers. Nida hopes to have a successful harvest soon. She also hopes for her family to have a more stable standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies, such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is a 43-year-old married woman with six children. She and her husband run a fishing business together. Andresa's husband operates their fishing boat to catch fish, and Andresa sells her husband's catch at their town's market. She also processes dried fish to sell. 

Andresa is requesting a loan to purchase fishing nets, floaters, and lead weights. She hopes for her family to experience a better quality of living.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, floaters, and lead weights.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is a 48-year-old married woman with five children. She makes and sells donuts and chips in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Amelia needs a loan to buy flour and packs of chips. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. Amelia has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making donuts.

loans.name: Salu

texts.en:
Salu is 18 years old and married with two children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taro and taamu that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. Salu needs a loan to buy chemicals, more taro crops, etc. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. Salu will use the profits from her sales to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Leala

texts.en: Leala is a 64-year-old woman with 10 children. She makes and sells local food in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Leala needs a loan to buy some equipment, meats, flour, etc. She plans to use her profits to pay her children’s school fees. Leala has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and ingredients for making food

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 32 years old and married with five children. She has a small garden where she grows tomatoes, carrots, etc. that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Susana needs a loan to buy some equipment, like vegetable seeds, gloves, rakes, hoses, etc.
 
She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Susana will use the profits from her sales to pay for her children's fees.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and equipment for growing vegetables

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a 42-year-old married woman with nine children. She would like to start growing tomatoes, cucumbers, and carrots to earn a living. 

Julie has requested a loan to buy equipment such as rakes, gloves, a wheelbarrow, and vegetable seeds to start her business. She will spend her profits to improve her business in the future. Julie has been a member of SPBD for two years.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for growing vegetables.

loans.name: Manuia

texts.en:
Manuia is a 52-year-old married woman with seven children. To earn a living, she makes and sells german buns, donuts, and other local foods in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Manuia needs a loan to buy salt, flour, sugar, and meats. She plans to use her profits to improve her business in the future. Manuia has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making snacks for sale.

loans.name: Nive

texts.en:
Nive is a 36-year-old married woman with four children. 

She would like to start growing taro, banana trees, and breadfruits to earn a living. Nive has requested a loan to buy farming equipment to start her business. 

She has been a member of SPBD for two years. Nive will spend her profits to improve her business and to save for her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Avasa

texts.en: Avasa is 20 years old and single. She wants to start a small business making and selling doughnuts, german buns, and pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy everything she needs for her business such as flour, oil, salt, sugar, and equipment. In the future, Avasa hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala is a 39-year-old married woman with five children. 

She would like to start growing taro, banana trees, and taamu to earn a living. Kalala has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, and equipment to make it easy for her to start a business.
 
She has been a member of SPBD for two years. Kalala will spend her profits on her children's fees and save some for her business.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Fatmata. She is a widow and has one 15-year-old child. She has three additional dependents who live with her because they serve as sales assistants. 

In 2007, Fatmata established her textiles business. She began her business to empower her to care for her child. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 1,900,000 SLL every month. 

Fatmata would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan to buy materials like poplin, siphon, and cheek. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to increase the level of her stock. She also plans to embark on international trade and to build a house. The rising cost of her supplies is one challenge she faces. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more textiles for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy retail stock.

loans.name: Ema

texts.en:
Ema is a 39-year-old woman with four children. 

She would like to start growing vegetables to earn a living. Ema has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, gloves, rakes, hoses, etc. 

She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Ema will use her profits to save for the future of her children and her business.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and equipment for growing vegetables

loans.name: Tiose

texts.en:
Tiose is a 32-year-old married woman with five children. 

She would like to start growing cucumbers, tomatoes, and cabbages to earn a living. Tiose has requested a loan to buy seeds, a rake, knives, and gloves.
 
She has been a member of SPBD for two years. Tiose will spend her profits on her business and her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing vegetables

loans.name: Jestina

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Jestina. She is married and has five children aged 20, 17, 14, 11 and 8 years. 

In 1997, Jestina established her patient medicine business to assist her husband in the running of the home. She went through training at the Nixiou Hospital in Segbwema. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 2,240,000 SLL every month. 

Jestina would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy more pharmaceuticals. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. 

In the future, Jestina plans to own a modern pharmacy and to establish a branch in Pujehun, her home town. She also hopes that the loan will increase her stock and capital. One challenge she faces is the proliferation of fake drugs. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceuticals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of tobacco leaf.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Saidu. He is married and has three children. He describes himself as hardworking and honest. 

 In 2007, Saidu established his cosmetics and jewelry business to enable him to provide for his family. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 1,620,000 SLL every month. 

Saidu would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL to buy items like necklaces, pink oil, palm cream, roll-on deodorant, and brown powder. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. 

In the future, Saidu plans to build a house and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coconut wine and coco vinegar to sell.

loans.name: Stela Marie

texts.en:
Stela Marie, 26, is the single mother of one child and lives in the Philippines. She has a shop that sells snacks like hot cake, banana cake, and cassava cake. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for 6,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients, such as sugar, flour, margarine, and cheese, to make snacks.

Stela Marie has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Stela Marie hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo has dreamed of becoming an entrepreneur his entire life and finally got the opportunity to live out this dream a few years ago. He worked for many years as an engineer in a company that was focused on the manufacturing of plastic goods. With this great experience and an understanding for the diversity of products that can be made from plastic and what goes into manufacturing them, Ricardo decide to start a business in this field. He decided to start a wholesale business that purchased and sold machines that were used for specialized plastic manufacturing. He saw no limits to his company and began selling domestically in the United States and internationally. He mainly sells to large companies and focuses most of his marketing to this kind of buyer. His business has seen significant growth since its founding and now employs three employees in addition to Ricardo. Ricardo wants to continue to see his company grow and wants to continue to provide for his family by doing something he loves. He would like to use this loan to purchase a larger inventory for resale and provoke growth.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for resale

loans.name: Sinuon's Group

texts.en:
Sinuon, 35, is a rural villager in the Dambae district of Cambodia. She and her husband work as farmers in order to feed their three children, two daughters and one son, who are still in school. For ten years, Sinuon has been planting cassava as a primary source of income for her family. She supplements this income by planting rubber trees. With the current business, she can earn around 21,600 KHR per day and can save around 9,000 KHR each day for the future. Falling cassava prices are the main challenge she faces in her business. This greatly affects her family's income. 

Sinuon is pictured with her loan group, which consists of four members. Sinuon is leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for farmland. She hopes to make more income so she can keep her children in school and improve their future employment prospects. 

This is the first loan for Sinuon and two other members, while the fourth member has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farmland.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata, 45, is married and has two children, ages 28 and 24. In 2002, she established her jewelry business. She began her business to assist her husband in running the home. The business is her only source of income. She works seven days a week and 10 hours a day, earning about Le550000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le3000000. She would use Le500,000 to buy earrings, Le300,000 to buy stay powder, Le500,000 to buy a gold plated wrist watch, Le300,000 to buy Bio clear cream, and Le400,000 to buy gents spray. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le250000. In the future, she plans to seek more financial assistance from ARD. She plans to visit the holy land of Mecca for pilgrimage and to rent a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more earrings, stay powder, gold plated wrist watch and Bio clear cream

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina, 73, is from Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed and has nine children. Regina used her last loan to purchase livestock feed. Her business has grown and become successful. Now, she's taking a new loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. She hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en: Felomina is from the village of Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Felomina is married and has three children. To make a living, she plants, harvests, and sells corn. She has been in this business for 16 years and earns 4,000 a month from these activities. In 2008, Felomina joined GDMPC. Felomina is requesting a loan of 5,000, which will be used to purchase fertilizers (such as manure). She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers (such as manure)

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en: Nelie is a 64-year-old widow with three children. She lives in Cabungaan, Claruin, Misamis Occidental. Nelie is a farmer, and she owns a plot of land where her coconut and banana production is planted. She has been doing this for 20 years, and every month she earns 4,500 from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Nelie has been a member of GDMPC for 5 years. In the future, Nelie hopes to finish the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Emprendedoras se conformó desde el año 2006, se encuentra integrado por 22 mujeres y  siguen trabajando  con el mismo entusiasmo y esfuerzo,  ya se encuentran en el 20º ciclo, siempre se han ayudado y trabajan juntas, es por ello que están cada vez mas unidas.
Alana forma parte del grupo, y ella nos comenta que gracias a la ayuda de su grupo ha podido ir creciendo, y sumado a esto también su arduo trabajo. Ella se dedica a la costura desde hace un tiempo, tiene ya muy buena clientela y gracias a Dios trabajo no le falta.
Solicita el crédito para poder seguir trabajando e invirtiendo en su taller, quiere telas, botones, gomas, cierres y demás, con lo que podrá cumplir con los trabajos pendientes. El grupo está muy agradecido por la ayuda que siempre reciben.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Emprendedoras committee was formed in 2006 by 22 members, all women entrepreneurs who have worked with strength and enthusiasm since beginning the group. They are currently in their 20th loan cycle. The members have always worked together and helped one another, growing stronger over time. 

Alana is a member of the group. Thanks to her own hard work and the help of the group, Alana's tailoring business has been growing. She has a good customer base and has been blessed with a steady stream of work. Alana is applying for a loan to invest in her tailoring business. She would like to buy more fabric, buttons, glue, zippers and other materials to will allow her to complete her current work. 

The group is very grateful for the financial support they have received from Fundacion Paraguaya.

loans.use: To buy cloth, buttons, glue, zippers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cartoons of maggie, bags of flour, rubbers of oil and bags of  salt

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en: Leonarda, 58, is from Bacolod, Ozamiz City. Leonarda is married and has nine children. She used her last loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. Her business is successful and she's taking a new loan for her farm to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next crop. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next crop.

loans.name: Aive

texts.en: Aive, 31, is married with one child. She lives in Capucao, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Aive owns and operates a plot of farm land, raising bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years and earns 3,000 each month. She requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Aive has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for three years. In the future, Aive's plan is to save her returns in order to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en:
Consorcia is 62 years old and lives in Poblacion 4, Clarin. Consorcia is married with nine children. 

Consorcia has a store where she sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 20 years. Consorcia requested a loan of 14,500 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Consorcia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Consorcia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents,etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for the motorcycle and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Bevencia

texts.en:
Bevencia is 47 years old and lives in Locuban, Dumalinao, ZDS. She is widowed with three children.                                                                                                       

To earn a living, Bevencia has a business selling snacks and other foods. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month. 

Bevencia has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Bevencia would like to established a carenderia, which is a type of local restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Lonito

texts.en:
Lonito, 49, is married with six children and resides in Guingona, Ozamis City, Philippines.

For 10 years, Lonito has been planting and harvesting corn to earn a living. He sells the corn in the local community, and each month he earns 6,000 PHP.

Lonito requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. In 2009, Lonito joined GDMPC. In the future, Lonito wants to save money for future emergencies and to purchase more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Doña Luz María, ella es  viuda,  tiene 55 años de edad, es propietaria de su propio negocio desde hace 22 años, en la elaboración de maxi, sus principales clientes son del extranjero,  Panamá, Costa Rica, el Salvador y Honduras. Comenta que en el mercado cuenta con 18 clientes fijo.
Se presenta a Ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo crédito para la compra de materia prima, actualmente tiene un pedido grande por lo que requiere suminístrale más a su negocio en la compra de seda por caja y tela da cron.

Considera que este crédito le ayudara a dar un mejor servicio, en el cumplimiento de su trabajo, mejorara su cálida de vida, y seguir dando a conocer al extranjero los productos que aquí se elabora de forma artesanal.
texts.en:
Doña Luz María, age 55, is a widow and has been a business owner for 22 years. She makes maxi dresses. Her main customers are from places abroad such as Panama, Costa Rica, El Salvador, and Honduras. She says that her market consists of 18 established customers.

Luz María came to CEPRODEL to request a new loan so that she can buy raw materials. She currently has a large order and needs additional supplies for her business. She will buy silk by the case and dacron fabric. Luz María believes this loan will help her provide better service and do a better job in her work. As a result, she will improve her quality of life and continue to receive recognition from abroad for her handmade products.

loans.use: to buy silk by the case and dacron fabric.

loans.name: Beatriz Milagros

texts.es:
Beatriz tiene 45 años de edad, es una mujer muy emprendedora y sobre todo entusiasta, vive al lado de su esposo quien trabaja como pescador y ambos apoyan con los gastos del hogar, juntos tiene 2 hijos a los cuales quiere muchísimo y por quienes se esfuerza mucho para sacarlos adelante y que sean mejores que ella; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Imperial, esta ciudad se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, también en esta distrito se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, plátano, entre otros.

Beatriz con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro y sobre todo el ánimo que le da ver a su familia inicio su negocio de venta de edredones, poco a poco fue mejorando y ya tiene 1 año trabajando en su negocio, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece muchas facilidades de pago a sus clientes y sobre todo porque los atiende con mucha amabilidad.

Beatriz está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas edredones para vender, de esta manera podrá tener mayores productos para ofrecer a sus clientes sobre todo para campaña del Día de la Madre, así ella seguirá trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y tener una galería de edredones”.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 45, is a very enterprising and enthusiastic woman.  She lives with her husband, who works as a fisherman, and they both support the household expenses.  Together they have 2 children who they love very much, and for whom they exert themselves a lot so that they can get ahead and so that their children can do well. Her house is located in the city of Imperial.  This is a city known for its warm and welcoming climate.  In addition, this district is a place especially suited for the cultivation of cotton, bananas and other agricultural products.

With a lot of effort and saving, and most of all, the encouragement of her family, she started up her business selling comforters.  She was gradually improving it, and now she has already had a year working in this business.  She believes that her business is doing well because she offers a lot of payment options for her customers, and most of all, because she tends to them with a lot of kindness.

Beatriz really appreciates the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help that they have provided her, she will be able to buy more comforters to sell.  In this way she will be able to have better products to offer her customers, especially for Mother's Day.  In this way, she will continue to work to make her greatest dream a reality: "to provide her children with a good education and to have a comforter store."

loans.use: to buy merchandise (comforters)

loans.name: Sofio

texts.en:
Sofio, 70, is married with five children and lives in Pan-ay Diot, Tudela.

For 15 years, Sofio has been growing fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. 

Sofio has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers, such as inorganic and commercial fertilizers. In the future, he hopes to send his children to school.

Sofio has been a member of PMPC for one month.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers such as inorganic and  commercial

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock for her general store.

loans.name: Tranquilino

texts.en:
Tranquilino, 70, is married with two children and lives in Nailon, Tudela.

For 25 years, Tranquilino has been growing fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living.

He has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as inorganic and commmercial fertilizers. In the future, he hopes to send his children to school.

Tranquilino has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma, 38, is married with five children and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena.

To earn a living, Alma sells snacks. She earns about 15,000 PHP each month. Alma has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase sacks of flour, cooking oil, margarine, and sugar. In the future, Alma would like to expand  her business.

She has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for food production.

location.town: Plaridel-Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock for her general store.

loans.name: Edgie May

texts.en:
Edgie May, 24, is married with two children and resides in Panta-on, Ozamis City, Philippines. For seven years, Edgie May has owned and operated a farm, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP. 

Edgie May requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase seeds and fertilizer. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family. 

In 2011, Edgie May joined GDMPC.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, 36, is a diligent mother and a resident of the Prey Chor district, where she owns and manages a rice farming business to earn a living. Her husband is a chef who, along with his team, provides food to large numbers of people attending events like parties, weddings, or funerals. The couple has six children, one of whom is working in a garment factory in Phnom Penh city.

Mao is now asking for a loan amounting to 3,000,000 KHR to pay fees on land that she bought from local villagers. She aims to increase her rice production and profit so that she can provide for her family’s needs. 

In the future, Mao hopes to make her business more successful through her effort and commitment.

loans.use: to pay land fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for food production.

loans.name: Miryan

texts.es:
La sra. Miryan es de la ciudad de Concepción, tiene 31 años , tiene un hijo recién nacido, está acompañada con el  Sr. Ronnie. Juntos tienen y trabajan en su Olería hace más de 5 años.
Comenta que les va muy bien ya que tienen una olería bien equipada con tres hornos funcionando. El junto a su pareja siempre se esfuerzan para que ahora el nuevo miembro de la familia, el día de mañana no tenga que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones.
Miryan solicita el crédito para la compra de chapa eternit para  el secado de los ladrillos, lo cual le ayudará mucho, ya que es una inversión a su negocio, lo cual le dará mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Miryan is from the city of Concepción. She is 31 years old and recently gave birth to a son. She lives with her common-law husband Ronnie.  Together they have a brick-making business and have worked in this business for over five years.  She says that things are going very well, and that their business is well-equipped, with three working kilns. 
 
They always work hard together since they now have a new member of their family and they do not want him to have to suffer any hardships. 

Miryan is seeking the loan to buy corrugated sheet metal for drying bricks.  This will be a vey helpful investment in her business, and it will bring her increased income.

loans.use: to buy corrugated sheet metal for drying bricks.

loans.name: Buenafe

texts.en:
Buenafe, 29, is married with two children and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. For seven years, Buenafe has been growing rice crops to earn a living. 

Buenafe has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as inorganic and commercial fertilizers. In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.
 
Buenafe has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, 40, is married with two children and lives in San Vicente, Sinacaban. For three years, Arlene has been raising pigs to earn a living. 

Arlene has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase feed for her pigs. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

Arlene has been a member of PMPC for four months.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky, 48, is married without children and lives in Tinacla-an, Clarin. For five years, she has been raising pigs to earn a living.

Vicky has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional feed for her pigs. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

Vicky has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Venchita

texts.en:
Venchita, 56, lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental and is single without children. Venchita has a clothing sales business and earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month. 

Venchita has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase ready-to-wear clothes. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

Venchita has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear clothing for sale.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita, 41, is married with two children and lives in Canibungan Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For six years, Charita has owned and operated a plot of farm land, planting coconuts to earn a living. She earns 8,000 PHP each month. 

Charita requested a loan of 9,500 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.						

Charita has been a member of Kiva partner GDMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Jahnefe

texts.en:
Jahnefe, 25, is married with two children and lives in the Philippines. For five years, she has been growing corn and palay to earn a living. 

Jahnefe has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase more fertilizer for her corn and palay. In the future, she hopes to harvest more crops.                                                                                                         

Jahnefe has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer for her corn and palay crop.

loans.name: Liezyl

texts.en:
Liezyl, 31, is married with two children and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. For two years, she has been raising pigs to earn a living. 

Liezyl has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional feed for her pigs. In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

Liezyl has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed.

loans.name: Edelisa

texts.en:
Edelisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an upholstery business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 22 years and also earns extra income raising pigs.

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional material for her upholstery business.

Edelisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of expanding her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her upholstery business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 53 years old and lives in Colupan Alto, Sinacaban. She is married with five children. 

To earn a living, Aida has a business selling suman, a type of rice cake, in the local community. She earns about 2,000 PHP each month. 

Aida has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase ingredients, such as flour, sugar, and oil. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

Aida has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for food production.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres unidas está integrado por 17 mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y por sobre todo emprendedoras de la ciudad de San Pedro. Son mujeres jefas de familia, humildes, pero con muchas ganas de superarse, trabajar y salir adelante.
Raquelina es la presidenta del grupo, y comenta que su grupo es excelente, todas ellas se ayudan y trabajan juntas en todo tipo de actividades a parte de lo que cada una hace. Raquelina por ejemplo cría animales, y con mucho esfuerzo está logrando salir adelante.
Solicita el crédito para poder comprar cerdos pequeños y pollitos para la cría, ya que quiere ir aumentando su cantidad de animales. Ella y su grupo agradecen por la ayuda que están recibiendo, ya que no cualquiera apostaría en ellas ya que son mujeres humildes.
texts.en:
United Women is made up of 17 dedicated, driven, and most of all hardworking women from the city of San Pedro. They are heads of their families, humble, and with lots of enthusiasm to succeed, work, and improve their lives. 
Raquelina is the president of the group and she comments that the group is excellent and they work together along with each individual's work.  Raquelina, for example, raises animals, and with much effort is doing very well.
She is requesting the loan to buy small pigs and chickens to raise since she wants to increase the amount of animals she owns. She and her group are thankful for the help they are receiving since not just anyone would bet on their success since they are such humble women.

loans.use: buy small pigs and chickens

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Narciso tiene 55 años, vive con su madre Manuela, de 96 años, a quien cuida en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Palcamayo, Tarma.
Él se dedica a la cerrajería, lleva como 25 años en esta actividad y comenta que le va bien, ya que fue el primero que abrió un negocio de ese rubro en su localidad. “La gente siempre viene y hace pedidos como; cerrojos, planchas metálicas, tubos para puertas, estufas metálicas”, comenta. Lo que más vende son puertas y ventanas de metal, también pequeñas estufas y casi siempre llaves. Con este trabajo ha conseguido mantener su hogar y a su anciana madre a la que cuida con mucho amor. Ahora piensa contratar una persona que le apoye en la atención de su negocio ya que solo se le hace difícil. 

Éste es el tercer préstamo que recibe de MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser responsable en el pago. Pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María”, un grupo sólido y responsable del que se siente orgulloso.
Invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de materiales para la realización de las construcciones metálicas que realiza.
texts.en:
Narciso is 55 years old and he lives with his mother, Manuela, who is 96. He cares for her in his own house located in the Palcamayo district in Tarma. 

For 25 years he has made a living as a locksmith. He says that it is going well as he was the first to start a business in this field in his area. "People always come and make orders for bolts, metal plates, tubes for doors, and metal stoves", he states. The item he sells the most are metal doors and windows as well as small stoves and keys, almost all of the time. Through his work he has been able support his home and his elderly mother whom he cares for with a lot of love. Now he is thinking about hiring a person who will help him tend to the business because doing it himself is tough. 

This is the third loan he has received from MFP, which is why he gives his word to be responsible in his repayments. He belongs to the “Virgen María” communal bank, a united and responsible group of which he is proud. 

He will invest the money he is requesting to purchase materials for the metal products he makes.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Primavera” es un comité de 11 mujeres, es un grupo muy unido, que siempre trabaja junto y que trata siempre de salir adelante. Estas señoras están muy animadas para seguir participando en este programa de microcrédito, mejorando así sus actividades económicas.
Vicenta es artesana, se dedica a la fabricación y venta de Ao Poi (Prenda típica Paraguaya). Desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a esto por lo que ya tiene buena experiencia. Comenta que esta fascinada con lo que hace, ya que esto es parte de nuestra cultura y su sueño es que sus nietos también lo aprendan.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, agujas, y otros insumos, con los que podrá seguir trabajando y haciendo sus prendas de ao poi.
texts.en:
The group “Primavera” (Spring) is a committee of 11 women. It’s a very unified group whose members always work together and always try to get ahead. These women are very excited to continue participating in this microfinance program, improving their businesses. 

Vicenta is an artisan. She makes and sells Ao Poi (traditional clothing from Paraguay). She’s been doing this for a long time and for that reason is very experienced. She says that she really enjoys what she does since it’s part of her culture, and her dream is that her grandsons will also learn the craft.  

She’s asking for a loan to buy fabric, thread, needles, and other supplies with which she will be able to continue working and making her Ao Poi.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Hing

texts.en:
Hing is 49 years old and the mother of six children. She lives with her family in the Ornlong Veng district. Her family’s main business is rice husbandry, which provides her family income to cover its daily expenses. She has been engaged in agribusiness for many years, and she has some of her children assist her in the business every year. 

Hing plans to expand her business and grow various kind of crops on her own farmland. Due the lack of capital, she would like to take out a loan of 1,500,000 HKR  to purchase farming supplies, such as seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. Also, she will hire laborers to prepare and plow her soil. 

Hing hopes to make her business viable and profitable in the coming years. This is her first loan, and she hopes that our lenders won’t reject it. She is happy and thankful for your help.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es una madre alegre y empeñosa, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos pequeñas hijas; Greni de 17 y Nicol de 7 años, a quienes les dedica el mayor tiempo necesario para estar juntas.
Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en la tienda que implementó en su casa hace más de 8 años. Comenta que le va muy bien desde ese entonces, porque siempre tiene ventas y tiene un ingreso para el sustento de sus hijas, quienes se encuentran en etapa escolar. Lo que más le gusta de su labor es ser independiente y no tener que estar lejos de sus hijas; pero su mayor dificultad es cuando ya no tiene suficiente mercadería para la atención a sus clientes. Sus planes a futuro, son de ampliar su negocio para vender al por mayor, de este modo le generaría más ganancias de las que ya obtiene.

Éste es su crédito número 7 con MFP, por lo que se siente contenta por la confianza que le brindan. En su banco comunal es una socia agradecida porque la eligieron como una de las miembros de la junta directiva.
Con el préstamo solicitado se abastecerá de productos comestibles para su tienda como; arroz, leche, conservas, azúcar, etc.
texts.en: Nancy is a joyful and hardworking mom, lives at home with her two daughters; Greni is 17 and Nicol 7, she dedicates as much time as needed to them to be together.  She sells groceries in a store she started out of her house eight years ago.  She's done very well since she started, always has sales and income to support her daughters who are studying.  What she likes the most about her work is being independent and not having to be apart from her daughters; a big difficulty is when she doesn't have enough merchandise for her customers.  Her future plans are to expand the business to sell at wholesale and generate more earnings than now.   This is her 7th loan with MFP, she feels happy about the trust they've given her.  In her community bank she is a grateful member because she was chosen to be in the board of directors.  With the requested loan she will stock with groceries such as rice, milk, canned food, sugar, etc.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as rice, milk, canned food, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es una mujer trabajadora de 48 años y esposa de Julio, de 54 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia junto a sus cuatro hijos, a quienes desean ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
 
Ella se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo. Desde muy temprano se van a sus campos de cultivo para ver las necesidades que puedan tener sus plantas de caco y café. Para ella, su trabajo es lo más importante, por eso le dedica su tiempo para tener buenas cosechas y venderlas a un buen precio. Lo que más le gusta de trabajo es al ver abundantes sus frutos después de tanto esfuerzo y considera que lo más difícil es no poder combatir las plagas que aquejan sus cultivos. Aun así, no pierde las esperanzas de seguir en esta actividad porque es lo que mejor sabe hacer. 

Éste es su tercer crédito con MFP. Le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal, ya que son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles que ahora solicita comprará abono y fertilizantes para realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas.
texts.en:
Natalia is a hard-working 48-year-old woman, married to Julio who is 54.  They live together in ahome with their four children, to whom they want to offer a better quality of life.

She works in agriculture together with her husband. They go to the field very early to determine what is needed for their cacao and coffee plants.

To her, work is a priority, that's why she dedicates time to it so they can have a good harvest and sell at good prices.  What she likes the most is being able to see abundant fruits after all the effort and she considers that the hardest is when she can't combat the weeds that affect her crops. In spite of this, she doesn't lose hope because this activity is what she can do best.

This is her third loan with MFP.  She likes being part of a community bank because they are responsible and helpful people.  With the 3,000 new soles that she requests she will buy fertilizers to take care of her plants.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 25 años, una joven afanosa y cabal; vive con Wilmer, de 27 años, en su casa propia junto a su pequeña hija, Yavela de 7 años, a quien le dan mucho amor y desean un futuro mejor para ella.
Hace 4 años que se dedica a la agricultura, ahora junto a su pareja, se van a trabajar desde muy temprano en sus tierras de cultivo donde producen cacao. Los productos de Nelly son de buena calidad y comenta que las asociaciones de acopio compran sus productos y no se quejan de los buenos granos de cacao que produce. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que lo hace junto a su pareja y ambos lo hacen con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo, ya que gracias a esa labor pueden solventar los gastos de su hogar. 
Para más adelante, desea comprar un terreno más amplio donde pueda cultivar más plantas de cacao.

Éste es su tercer crédito con MFP. Le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal, ya que trabaja con personas responsables.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles que solicita podrá comprar injertos de cacao y cultivarlos en su parcela.
texts.en:
Nelly is 25, a hardworking and responsible young woman; she lives with Wilmer, 27 at their house with their 7 year-old daughter Yavela, to whom they give much love and wish for her a better future.  Four years ago she started working in agriculture, now she does with her partner, they leave for work very early and go to their field to produce cacao.  Nelly's products are good quality and she says that the associations buy her products and never complain about the good cacao beans she produces.  What she likes the most about her job is working with her partner and they both are very dedicated and hard-working because thanks to this activity they can cover their home expenses.  Later on she wants to buy a bigger piece of land where she can grow more cacao plants.  

This is her third loan with MFP.  She likes being part of a community bank because they are responsible people.  With the 2,000 new soles that she requests she will buy cacao plants to grow them in her land.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
Nicanor es un joven soltero de 20 años, vive en la casa de sus hermanos, a quienes agradece por brindarles un techo donde vivir.
Hace 5 meses que empezó a trabajar como obrero en su localidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que siempre está con sus compañeros, con quienes comparte momentos de alegría; considera que lo más difícil es tener que laborar en demasiado calor, ya que no es fácil soportar. 
Pero, los fines de semana se dirige a sus campos de cultivo de cacao, ya que realiza dos actividades para cumplir con sus objetivos. 
Para el futuro, desea comprarse un terreno para construir su casa. Pero por el momento, lo que necesita es quitar la hierba y abonar sus plantas de cacao.

Éste es su segundo crédito con MFP. En su banco comunal se siente muy contento por la oportunidad de trabajar juntos, solidariamente.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles que ahora solicita comprará abono y otros fertilizantes para esparcir en su parcela.
texts.en:
Nicanor is a 20-year-old single young man, he lives at his siblings' house, to whom he thanks for providing a roof to live under.  Five months ago he started working as a journeyman of his area.  What he likes the most about his job is being with his co-workers, with whom he shares moments of joy; he considers the hardest part to work under very hot weather that is hard to bear.

On the weekends he goes to his cacao plant field as he works on two activities to reach his goals.  In the future he would like to buy a piece of land to build a house.  For now he needs to get rid of weeds and fertilize his plants.

This is his second loan with MFP.  In his community bank he feels happy for the opportunity to work with them in solidarity.  With the 2,000 new soles he requests he will buy fertilizers to spread on his land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Pora Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité  Pora Aty se formo en la ciudad de San Pedro, son 11 mujeres que trabajan duro para poder ayudar a sus hijos y a sus familiares. Son mujeres luchadoras y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y es por ello que siempre se esfuerzan.
Hilda es una de las miembros y nos cuenta que se dedica a la cría de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, chanchos, patos, cabras y demás tipos, y solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, ya que no quiere quedarse sin stock.
Ella agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la ayuda que están recibiendo ellas y sus amigas.
texts.en:
The committee "Pora Aty" was formed in the city of San Pedro. It has 11 women who work hard so that they can help their children and their families. They are determined women who have plenty of drive to succeed. For this reason, they always strive to do their best.

Hilda is one of the members. She says that she raises farm animals such as chickens, pigs, ducks, goats, and other livestock. Hilda is requesting a loan to buy balanced feed for her animals since she does not want to run out of inventory. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the help she and her friends have received.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is single with 3 children. She is 57 years old and lives in Tinacla-an, Clarin. Crisanta is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living.
She has been doing this for 10 years. Crisanta has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional feeds. 
She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Crisanta hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 37 años, es soltera y vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos hijas; Diana de 19 años y Sandy de 15 años; a quienes brinda amor y una buena educación.
Ella es una mujer empeñosa y laboriosa, su trabajo es en los campos de cultivo, donde tiene plantas de cacao. Esta labor la aprendió desde muy pequeña, ya que sus padres le enseñaron, y hace 17 años que lo hace de forma independiente en su propia parcela. Su producción la vende a los centros de acopio de su localidad. Además, cuando es necesario, cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros para que le apoyen en el mantenimiento de sus plantas evitando que las malezas interrumpan su crecimiento.
Para el futuro desea ampliar sus cultivos comprando un terreno y más plantas de cacao. Y ahora también está interesada en terminar la fachada de su casa.

Éste es su crédito número 7 con MFP y asegura que será puntual con sus cuotas de pago. En su banco comunal es una socia activa y responsable.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles que solicita comprará abono para sus cultivos y también pintura para pintar su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 37, she is single and lives at home with her two daughtes Diana, 19 and Sandy, 15 to whom she provides love and a good education.
She is a hardworking woman, her job is in the crop fields, where she has cacao plants.  She learned this activity since she was little from her parents and has been doing it independently for 17 years in her own land.  She sells her production to the pooling centers of her community, in addition, when necessary, she has the support of journeyman that help her maintain the plants getting rid of that weeds threaten the growth of her plants. 
In the future she wants to expand by buying more land and cacao plants.  Currently, she is also interested in finishing the outside of her house.  

This is her 7th loan with MFP and she assures she will be punctual with the repayments of the loan, she is an active and responsible member of her community bank.  With the 3,000 new soles that the requested she will buy fertilizer for her crops and paint to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to buy paint for her house.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es:
Rosana tiene 30 años, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Gelasio, de 34 años, y sus dos queridos hijos; Henry de 11 y Mariela de 9 años. Y lo que más desea es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Su actividad principal es la agricultura, tiene en un campo de cultivo con plantas de cacao. Esta labor la realiza desde hace 13 años, y junto a su esposo están al pendiente de su parcela. Sus cosechas las llevan a los centros de acopio de su localidad, donde le pagan muy bien por cada kilo de cacao. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede vender fácilmente su producto por ser de buena producción. Para el futuro aspira ampliar su parcela y poder abrir un negocio en su casa, pero por el momento desea en terminar de techar su casa poder habitar allí y no tener que gastar en alquiler.

Éste es su crédito número 6 con MFP y está muy contenta por el apoyo brindado para concretar con sus planes. Está dispuesta a seguir pagando sus cuotas puntualmente, y sobre su banco comunal dice estar contenta porque es un grupo de personas responsables.
Los 3,000 nuevos soles que solicita los invertirá en su chacra, y  también comprará materiales para poder culminar su casa.
texts.en:
Rosana is 30, she lives in a house she rents with her husband Gelasio, 34 and their two beloved children; Henry, 11 and Mariela, 9.  Her biggest wish is to give her family a better quality of life.  Her main activity consists of agriculture, she has a piece of land with cacao plants.  She has worked in this activity for 13 years and together with her husband they maintain the crops.  Her products are sold to the pooling centers of her community where they pay very well for each kilogram of cacao beans.  What she likes the most about her job is the ability to sell her product easily thanks to having a good quality production.  In the future she hopes to expand the land and have a business out of her house, but for now she hopes to finish the roof of her house to live there and stop paying for rent. 

This is her 6th loan with MFP and she is very happy for the support provided to finish her plans.  She is ready to continue paying for her loan punctually and she is happy with her community bank because it's a group of responsible people.

The 3,000 new soles that she requests will be invested in the land and she will also buy materials to finish her house.

loans.use: to invest in her land and fix her house

loans.name: Yulver

texts.es:
Yulver tiene 37años, vive con su esposa Roselin y sus dos hijos. Su casa es propia y se ubica en el distrito de Palcamayo, Tarma. 
Él es un hombre muy esmerado en todas las actividades que realiza, más aún en la agricultura que es su principal fuente de sustento. En sus terrenos propios siembra espinaca, arvejas, zanahorias y flores. “Mis productos se venden bien en el mercado mayorista, pero lo que me conviene sembrar más son arvejas y flores”, menciona. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es trabajar al aire libre y sin horarios condicionados. En los más de 25 años en está actividad cree que lo más difícil es trasladar sus productos desde las parcelas hasta el mercado, por eso contrata personal constantemente. Además recibe la ayuda incondicional de su pareja, quien lo atiende cuando sale a trabajar porque sabe que es por el bien de su familia.
Una de sus metas es mejorar sus cultivos y sembrar más flores (gladiolos) para el mes de noviembre que es cuando los precios aumentan favorablemente.

Éste es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María”, un grupo sólido de buenos integrantes y socios responsables.
Con el dinero que solicita podrá adquirir una bolsa de semillas de arvejas (550 soles). Lo restante será para pagar a los jornaleros que contratará.
texts.en:
Yulver, 37, lives with his wife Roselin and their two children. They own their home in the district of Palcamayo, Talma. Yulver takes great pains in all the work he does, especially in farming which is his main source of sustenance. On land that he owns, he plants spinach, peas, carrots and flowers. "My products sell well in the wholesale market, but the most profitable to plant are peas and flowers," he says. What he likes most about his job is working outside without a set schedule. In the more than 25 years that he's been in this trade, he thinks the hardest part is getting his products from the land to the market because he constantly has to hire laborers. He has unconditional support from his wife, who tends to him when he goes out to work because she knows it's for the good of the family. 

One of his goals is to improve his crops and plant more flowers (gladiolas) for the month of November, which is when prices increase favorably.

This is his 5th loan with MFP. He promises to make his monthly payments punctually. He belongs to the village bank "Virgen Maria", a solid group with good and responsible members. With the money he will be able to buy a bag of pea seeds (550 soles). The rest will be used to pay the workers that he will hire.

loans.use: to buy seeds and hire day laborers.

loans.name: Dalila Eufemia

texts.es:
La Señora. Dalila es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, vive por el sector de la Feria Libre en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad de una gran belleza natural que desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Dalila tiene 59 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, 3 de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja y le ayuda  económicamente. Su esposo es jubilado y ahora labora como comerciante, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Dalila se  dedica al comercio, vende todo tipo de ropa, sabanas, edredones, toallas y más productos,  cuenta con una selecta clientela a quienes vende sus productos, hace un año también se dedica al negocio de cría de pollos. 

Es socia de la banca comunal hace 8 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar de ropa, sabanas, edredones, etc. para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Su sueño es comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Dalila is a member of the community bank Loma de la Cruz, she lives in the Feria Libre sector of the city of Cuenca, city with great natural beauty that in 1999 became part of the World's Cultural Heritage, it's gastronomy captures the palates of locals and foreigners, its people are nice, hospitable and still maintain the culture and traditions of the city. 

Dalila is 59, she is married and has four children, three of them are married and live independently, her single son works and helps her with the expenses.  Her husband is retired and now works as a merchant, they don't own a house so they rent.

Dalila is a merchant and sells all kinds of clothing, sheets, comforters, towels and other products, she has a client base to whom she sells her products and a year ago she also started growing chicken.

She has been a member of the community bank for wight years and her new loan will be invested in buying clothing, sheets, comforters, etc to continue growing her business.

Her dream is to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sheets, comforters, etc.

loans.name: Karina Verónica

texts.es:
La Señora. Karina es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, vive por el sector de la Feria Libre en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad de una gran belleza natural que desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Karina es muy joven tiene 22 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido un hijo de 2 años de edad. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Nuestra socia hace un mes labora como empleada privada, en sus tiempos libre se dedica a la venta de ropa y lleva un año en esta actividad, su mercadería la vende recorriendo la ciudad.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa.
 
Su meta es de culminar sus estudios universitarios ya que estudiaba la carrera de Turismo.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the community bank Loma de la Cruz, she lives in the Feria Libre sector of the city of Cuenca, city with great natural beauty that in 1999 became part of the World's Cultural Heritage, it's gastronomy captures the palates of locals and foreigners, its people are nice, hospitable and still maintain the culture and traditions of the city. 

Karina is very young, at 22 she lives with her partner and has a two year old son.  Her partner is a merchant, they don't own a house so they rent.

Our member works as a private sector employee during her free time she sells clothing, she has been doing this for a year and sells by going around the city.

She has been a member of the community bank for a year and her new loan will be invested in clothing.  Her goal is to finish her university degree majoring in Tourism.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, vive por el sector de la Feria Libre en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad de una gran belleza natural que desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. María tiene 47 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 3 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña María nos comenta que se encuentra un poco delicada de salud ya que  sufre de  un dolor constante de su cuerpo pero aun no se ha realizado ningún chequeo médico, su familia está gozando de muy buena salud.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica al comercio de periódicos, billetes de lotería y revistas, negocio en el  que se encuentra hace 30 años, iniciándose en este negocio porque es una mujer emprendedora y se vio en la necesidad de salir adelante con su familia.

Su crédito anterior lo ha invirtió en la compra de mercadería y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando mas billetes de lotería y periódicos, en el pago de su crédito anterior se atraso un poco porque las ventas estaban muy bajas.  La banca comunal le gusta porque con los créditos le dan la oportunidad de crecer en su negocio.

Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
María is a member of the community bank Loma de la Cruz, she lives in the Feria Libre sector of the city of Cuenca, city with great natural beauty that in 1999 became part of the World's Cultural Heritage, it's gastronomy captures the palates of locals and foreigners, its people are nice, hospitable and still maintain the culture and traditions of the city. 

Maria is 47, lives with her partner and has three children that are now adults, married and live independently.  Her partner is a merchant, they don't own a house so they rent.

Maria mentions having a bit of a health issue, because she has a constant pain in her body, but she hasn't gone for a check up yet, her family is in good health.

Our member works selling newspapers, lottery tickets and magazines, her business has been around for 30 years, she started this business because she is a hardworking woman and saw the need to get ahead with her family.

Her previous loan was invested in merchandise and her new loan will be invested in buying lottery tickets and newspapers, she was a bit late in her previous loan repayments because the sales were very low.  She likes the community bank because their loans give her an opportunity to grow her business.

Her dream is to own a house.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets and newspapers

loans.name: Avenel

texts.es:
Avenel tiene 47 años, está casado con Lucía, con quien tiene 7 hijos. Dos de ellos se encuentran en la ciudad de Lima, por lo tanto sólo viven con cinco. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en una comunidad nativa de Chanchamayo.

Éste empeñoso hombre se dedica a la agricultura desde que empezó a poyar a sus padres en las labores del campo. Con estos conocimientos decidió producir sus propios productos y formar su familia. Le va bien, con lo que obtiene es capaz de brindarles a sus hijos estudios, pues dos de ellos están en la ciudad capital. Siembra plátanos, café, yucas, maíz y achiote en un promedio de 4 cuadras de cultivos. Lo que cosecha lo comercializa en la ciudad y algunas veces en su propia comunidad. “Tengo más plátanos y café, así no me falta dinero en todo el año”, comenta. Con la ayuda de su esposa y algunos jornaleros que contrata para el arduo trabajo puede optimizar su labor y no descuidar sus ventas. 
Avenel tiene metas claras, una de ellas es que sus hijos realicen estudios superiores y sean independientes; por ello trabajará como lo hace ahora.

Éste es su préstamo número 5 con MFP, por eso está decidido a pagar las cuotas con responsabilidad. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Pomporitos de Shankivironi” y le agrada el trabajo en equipo.
Con el dinero que solicita podrá comprar bolsas de abono orgánico y también pagará los servicios de los jornaleros quienes limpiarán sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Avenel, 47, is married to Lucia, with whom he has 7 children. Two of them live in the city of Lima, so they only live with five of their children. They own a home in the indigenous community of Chanchamayo.

This persevering man has worked in agriculture since he began helping his parents in the field. With this knowledge he decided to produce his own crops and form a family. It's going well; with what he earns, he is able to put his kids through school. Two of them are in the capital city. He plants plantains, coffee, yucca, corn and annatto on an average of 4 blocks of land. He sells his harvest in the city and sometimes in his own community. "I have more plantains and coffee, so I don't lack money all year," he says. With the help of his wife and some laborers that he contracts for the harder work, he is able to optimize his work and not overlook his sales. 

Avenel has clear goals; one of them is for his children to complete higher education and be independent. For that reason, he will continue working as he does now. 

This is his 5th loan with MFP, and he is dedicated to making his payments responsibly. He belongs to the village bank "Los Pomporitos de Shankivironi" and is grateful for the teamwork. With his loan he will be able to buy bags of organic compost and will also pay laborers who will clean up his plantings.

loans.use: to buy compost and hire workers.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 36 years old and married with 3 children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Lucita has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling livestock.

Lucita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad tiene 53 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 25 años, con quien vive en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de  Palcamayo, Tarma.

Ella se dedica a varias actividades. Inicia desde muy temprano con la venta de leña, y las vende muy rápido porque lleva más de 30 años y sabe cómo funciona este negocio. Así también se hace cargo de sus parcelas donde siembra verduras como; espinacas, arvejas, lechugas, zanahorias, etc. Soledad es una mujer muy carismática y alegre, con estas características siempre tiene clientes, tanto para sus cultivos como para la venta de leña. “Trabajo sola hace muchos años, todo lo hago por mi hijo, ya que le falta poco para terminar sus estudios universitarios”, menciona orgullosa.
Una de sus metas es ver a su hijo realizarse como persona, y luego consolidar su negocio de leña, para vivir tranquilamente. También quiere administrar sus cultivos contratando peones para dejar de hacer el trabajo físico.

Éste es su crédito número 10 con MFP, por eso se muestra confiada de que pagará con puntualidad la cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María”, un grupo sólido y trabajador que lleva varios años desempeñando un trabajo solidario y responsable.
Con el dinero solicitado comprará tres bolsas (550 soles cada una) de semillas de arvejas, para su nueva siembra.
texts.en:
Soledad is 53 years old, single, and has a 25-year-old son who lives with her in her home in the District of Palcamayo, Tarma. She engages in various activities. Soledad starts very early by selling wool, but her inventory sells quickly because she has been doing this for 30 years and knows how her business should operate. She also looks after her parcels of land where she grows vegetables such as spinach, peas, lettuce, carrots, and other crops. Soledad is a woman who is known for her charisma and cheerfulness, which are qualities that help her to hold on to customers. In addition to her crops, she also sells firewood. "I have worked alone for many years since everything I do is for my son so that he lacks nothing and can finish his university studies," she says proudly. One of her goals is to see her son develop as a person. Later on she would like to strengthen her firewood business so that she can live peacefully. Soledad would also like to manage her crops by hiring workers to handle all of the physical work.

This is her tenth loan with MFP. Soledad has demonstrated that she is trustworthy by submitting her payments on time. She is a member of the Communal Bank "Virgen María" (Virgin Mary), a steadfast and hardworking group that has demonstrated unity and responsibility in their work over many years. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy three bags (costing 550 PEN each) of pea seeds for her next planting cycle.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is 43 years old and lives in Tinacla-an, Clarin. She is married with 4 children. 
Merilyn has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 5 years Merilyn requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents,etc.
She has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Merilyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents,etc.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 36 years old and married with 7 children.

Rosana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Rosana has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Rosana aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She has a lumberyard business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening and farming rice. Anita is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase more wood to sell in her lumberyard business.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: seeds, fertilizers, insecticides. etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana tien 37 años, está casada con Remigio, con quien tiene cinco hijos, pero viven con cuatro de ellos; los de 15, 13, 10 y 8 años. Esta familia vive en su casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa en Chanchamayo.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde que era niña. Cuenta con dos parcelas de terreno donde siembra plátanos de tres variedades: isla, bellaco y largo.  Así también, produce cacao en media parcela, “Cacao siembro hace años y sí me conviene porque cada kilo está ahora a 6 soles con 50 céntimos, pero hay meses en que llega a costar 11 soles”, menciona. A pesar de la baja de precios, considera que éste fruto es el que más satisfacciones le da. Su cosecha es una vez al año, mientras tanto se solventa con la venta de plátanos que recoge cada 20 días.
El principal problema que encontró en todos estos años que lleva como mujer del campo es la falta de capital, por eso agradece el apoyo brindado.  Gracias al trabajo coordinado entre ella y su esposo, pueden cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hijos. Susana no es conformista, por eso quiere ampliar sus cultivos de cacao y continuar con la agricultura porque es la actividad que domina y le agrada.

Éste es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas como en ocasiones anteriores. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Pomporitos de San Cristóbal” y se siente a gusto de trabajar con personas responsables.
Con el dinero solicitado podrá comprar mamones de plátanos para sembrarlos en los espacios vacíos de sus parcelas. También pagará a los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza y cultivo de sus productos.
texts.en:
Susana is 37 years old and married to Remigio with whom she has five children. Four of the children live with them and they are 15, 13, 10 and 8 years old. They live in the own home located in the native community of Chanchamayo.

She has worked in agriculture since she was a young girl. She has two parcels of land where she grows three varieties of bananas: Isla, Bellaco and lLargo. She also cultivates cacao on half a parcel. Susana says "I have been growing cacao for years and it benefits me because each kilogram is being sold now for 6.50 soles but there are months that it increases to 11 soles". Even though prices are lower, she considers this fruit to be the one that gives her the most satisfaction. Her harvest occurs once a year and meanwhile she makes money harvesting bananas every twenty days. 

The main problem that she found in all these years, being a woman from the countryside, is the lack of capital. She is grateful for the support from MFP. Thanks to the coordinated efforts of her husband and herself, they can cover the basic necessities of their children. Susana is not a conformist and therefore wants to increase her cacao harvest and continue with agriculture because she has a good command of it and it gives her pleasure.

This is her fifth credit with MFP. She is committed to making her payments on time, as she has done in the past. She belongs to the communal bank "Los Pomporitos de San Cristóbal" and she feels comfortable working with these responsible people. With the loan, she will be able to buy banana plants and plant them in the empty spaces of her parcels. She will also pay the day laborers that she will hire for the cleaning and cultivation of her products.

loans.use: purchase banana plants.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Maria Eugenia es una mujer de bajos recursos economicos humilde pero muy trabajadora. Madre de cinco hermosos hijos de los cuales se siente muy orgullosa. Su labor ha sido la venta ambulante de elote, yoltamales, wirila, tamales, tamales rellenos; negocio que ha sido para ella su principal fuente de ingresos para llevar el pan de cada dia a su hogar. Como madre desea el mejor porvenir para sus hijos, razon misma que le conlleva una vez mas a acudir a la micro-financiera es la construccion de su muro perimetral en su vivienda obteniendo con el mismo seguridad, mejores condiciones y un mejor nivel de vida. Pero para dicha construccion requerira comprar piedras canteras, piedrin, alambre de amarre, estribos, cemento, bloques, piedrin, tablas, clavos entre otros y asi empezar la infraestructura que sin duda sera motivo de alegria para sus hijos, esposo y su persona.
texts.en:
Maria Eugenia is a humble and extremely hardworking woman who has limited financial resources. She is the mother of five beautiful children who make her feel proud. Her job is that of a street vendor who sells corn on the cob, corn tamales, "wirilas" (sweet tortillas stuffed with cheese), tamales, and stuffed tamales. Maria's business is the main source of income by which she is able to earn a daily living for her household. Like any mother, she wants to provide a better future for her children.

Her reason for requesting another micro-loan is to build a wall around her home in order to provide more security, better conditions, and a better standard of living. In order for the construction to occur, she needs to buy quarry stones, gravel, wire, supports, cement, blocks, rulers, nails, and other supplies. Starting the construction will be a reason for her, her husband, and her children to be happy.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a security wall around her home.

loans.name: Kingugi Group

texts.en:
Awesa, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children; none of them go to school. She has been a food vendor for three years now.  She works from 5 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to restock missing items, household expenses and has repaid her loan successfully.  She hopes for a loan to increase her food stock and sell more food. Her dream is to one day be able to pay school fees for her children.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kingugi" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase her food stock and sell more food.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 34 años, está casada con Luciano hace 17 años. Ellos tienen cuatro hijos de 17, 15, 13 y 11 años. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en la comunidad nativa San Cristóbal de Shankivironi en Chanchamayo.

Ella se dedica al trabajo del campo, posee dos parcelas de terreno donde produce piñas, plátanos, carambolas, café y yucas; además de media parcela de naranjas plantadas y tres en plena cosecha. “Me encargo de administrar mi producción y contrato personal para que trabaje”, menciona, ya que antes ella también se dedicaba al trabajo arduo. 
Por su parte, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de electrificación, donde recibe una remuneración mensual, por eso viaja constantemente a distintas ciudades por cada proyecto que le designen.
Marcelina cuida sus cultivos con mucho ahínco porque sabe que gracias a un buen cuidado puede obtener buenos ingresos para su familia. La mayor parte de su producción la comercializa en la ciudad y de vez en cuando llegan compradores hasta su propia comunidad. 
Ella espera mejorar sus cultivos, especialmente el café, que es uno de los mejores frutos y así optimizar su calidad de vida. 

Éste es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por eso menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Pomporitos de San Cristóbal” y se siente identificada con el grupo, al punto de tomar la responsabilidad como tesorera.
Invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de bolsas de abono, y en el pago del personal que contratará para la limpieza y abono de sus cultivos de café, ya que se encuentra en plena cosecha.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 34 years old and has been married to Luciano for 17 years. They have four children, ages 17, 15, 13, and 11. They own their own house and it is located in the indigenous community of San Cristóbal de Shankivironi in Chanchamayo.

She works in agriculture. She has two parcels of land that produce pineapples, bananas, starfruit, coffee, and yucca. She also has half a parcel planted with oranges and three in full harvest. "I am in charge of administering my production and I hire laborers to do the work," she mentions, as she used to also do the hard labor herself.
